Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: KarenWarwick_England
Reviews.Content: A small but wonderful paradise tucked away down a quiet back street, but very close to the Champs Elysees. Beautifully decorated, very clean and a yummy breakfast. Staff very welcoming and helpful. Would highly recommend and hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mjsvacation
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 5 nights in March and we could not have had a better experience! This was our first trip to Paris and the concierges Philippe and Cédric were so helpful and gracious with any assistance we required. They took care of car services, restaurant reservations, etc. The suite we stayed in was beautifully decorated and very comfortable, a welcome retreat to return to after each day of touring. The breakfast was also perfect with many choices that would appeal to everyone, the fresh pastries were delicious. One of the days we had traveled all the way out to Normandy for a tour and were very tired when we returned. They took care of ordering dinner for us from a nearby Italian Restaurant and set it up in a quiet area with a fireplace and champagne making the day end perfectly. We could not have been more pleased with our stay and would recommend this hotel to any friends and family traveling to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: TravelFromPhila
Reviews.Content: We used to stay in larger hotels in Paris, but after this hotel, we are definitely staying here or will explore other boutique hotels. Concierges are so knowledgeable and accommodating that we could not be happier. Even the owner of the hotel was great. When we met with her she was happy to answer all our questions. Extremely clean hotel, very comfortable sleeping. The breakfast was pretty good, try to get it to be included as an upgrade option. Definitely going to stay there again. As a matter of fact, we called them a month ago and they were sold out for beginning of April, so we are going to try the new boutique hotel this time. We will update you after we come back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, central location and lovely breakfast”
Reviews.Author: familylondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at the end of March for a birthday treat. It started well when we were upgraded to the penthouse suite. All beautifully decorated and well laid out with excellent views. The staff were extremely helpful with restaurant advice, taxis etc Breakfast was great . There is no restaurant onsite but room service is available from a local bistro and there are plenty of restaurants in walking distance. The small gym is well equipped but the machinery could do with a service - a minor point only. Overall a lovely stay, would definitely recommend and would be keen to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: pearson02
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exactly what I think of when I hear "boutique hotel." Though my room was small, it was beautifully decorated and comfortable. My room had windows opening over a courtyard area, and it was peaceful and quiet in the middle of Paris. The concierge was very helpful--he even called multiple bars in the area looking for one that would be broadcasting the team I wanted to see in the NCAA tournament. Completely unnecessary but much appreciated. The breakfast was lovely as well. In addition to traditional European fare, there were eggs and sausages as well as a very nice sautéed mushroom accompaniment. The location was also very convenient. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoGirlLisa
Reviews.Content: I could not ask for anything more in a hotel. The staff was so kind, welcoming and all about service. The hotel manager was very nice as well. The breakfast was delicious and there was more than enough food available. Again wonderful waitstaff. We had a beautiful view of the Eiffel Tower. The hotel is close to everything. Comfortable bed and pillows. Hair dryer, iPod dock and in room coffee machine with pods in rooms. They made our first trip to Paris very memorable. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: discovery2106
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. The decor is so stunning especially the breakfast room. The service is perfect- they really do go out of their way to make sure your stay is fabulous. They recommended great restaurant options for us. The hotel is beautifully kept and was a perfect stay for a five day break pre- Christmas. The location was great - we walked absolutely everywhere. Our room faced the inner courtyard and was on a low floor so it lacked natural and we did feel a little hemmed in. However this such a little gem with exceptional service, well kept rooms and in a great location. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: AndreyKuznetsov
Reviews.Content: It was quite difficult to change Marriott/Renaissance group of hotels to the Keppler. Most of us are under the pressure of different loyalty programms. And sometimes we do not want to look around... Tripadvisor is very good source to understand the real things. According to reviews, Keppler is more attractive than many others in the same category. Kepler just a perfect choice! Clean, calm and comfort. Very nice room, very good location, no noice from street. Excellent team which do excellent everything! My family members were happy about breakfast. I was happy about restaurant recommendations. That is why I can recommend this hotel for business or tourist purposes. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: brooksie22
Reviews.Content: Keppler is a great hotel in Paris, its quiet, on a side road not far from the Champs Elysees. Staff are helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect honeymoon hotel”
Reviews.Author: spellboundc5
Reviews.Content: This review is much overdue since we stayed at the Keppler in Sept. 2011 for 5 nights for our honeymoon. However, we enjoyed the beautiful Keppler and its location so much that it warrants a top rating from us. It's wonderfully located near the Champs Elysee/Arc De Triomphe. From the quaint rue Keppler we walked everywhere. The concierge was wonderful and helped us enjoy several wonderful meals at phenomenal restaurants. The hotel itself has a very stylish boutique feel - we stayed in the executive suite - still small but typical for Paris - beautifully appointed. Especially loved the gorgeous marble bathroom. We have very fond memories of our trip to Paris and Hotel Keppler was a terrific part of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great little central place.”
Reviews.Author: Kommandousen
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel for one night in order to celebrate my daughters 18 ears birthday. We reserved two ordinary rooms and paid via the webpage. When we arrived by car, we noted that the street was very narrow and no obvious parking spaces. But the concierge managed to get os squeezed into a slot in the street and we checked in. My wife and I got upgraded - free - to a very nice suite with two rooms in a corner with a view to the street. The rooms were very nice, clean and enjoyed free internet access and plenty of flatscreen TVs. The breakfast was served in the basement in a small restaurant and provided a decent selection. The hotel staff were very attentive and helpful and all spoke very good english. The hotel is ideally located 200 meters from Arche de Triumphe and Champs E'lysses and in walking distances from all relevant spots in central Paris. This is a good place to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Paris in the (nearly) Spring”
Reviews.Author: chasm1
Reviews.Content: Overall a very enjoyable stay at the Keppler. We went with our children and relatives and had a very busy time visiting the obvious tourist attractions. The hotel is very nicely furnished and decorated. The rooms are on the small side but very well appointed. Staff were charming, friendly and helpful, although we weren't totally convinced that the concierges gave us the best suggestions, either for meals or for attractions. The location is good, although the area lacks the life and character of the left bank, perhaps. To be honest, anywhere in Central Paris is going to be a good location - the main sights are all eminently walkable and that is one of the fun parts of a visit there. Highly recommended if it's in your price range and we would certainly return if and when we are back in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, if expensive Parisian boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Julesybabes
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated, 25mins walk to the Eiffel Tower, 5mins to the Arc de Trionfe and Champs Elysees. Wonderfully decorated and the staff are extremely attentive. The hotel has a breakfast service which I found to be very good with a great selection. The in room ammenities are superb (HD TV, iPod/iPhone compatible bedside clock/stereo), bathrobes, slippers, kettle on request (e.g. for babies). Possible caveats: the rooms are tight but adequate. Summary: If you want classy, stress free and beautiful accomodation look no further. But if on a budget... look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “What's all the fuss about?”
Reviews.Author: champagnetravels
Reviews.Content: Based on the high rating on tripadvisor and the location, we picked this hotel as a base for our 2 night stay. As much as I rely and love using tripadvisor, I have a feeling that hotels (those with high ratings) can rest on their laurels because of this and perhaps some lower rated hotels doesn't get a fair chance- That is why I have decided to give Hotel Keppler 3 stars- and these are my reasons: We booked this hotel as a valentines trip. I emailed the hotel a month before arriving to confirm our room and also to ask for restaurant recommendations since a) their concierge came highly recommended on here and b)it's valentines- everything will be booked. I patiently waited a week and after receiving no response i emailed them again. Again, i received absolutely no response. My husband called the hotel 2 days before leaving London to confirm they have our reservation and enquire why they haven't responded to any emails- they had "a problem with their system for the last 2 days".. hummm We found the hotel quite easily, it's a short walk from George V station, the lobby is small but elegant. Check in was straight forward and professional but not warm and engaging in the slightest. Perhaps the Parisian way but not what I gathered from previous reviewers? We had a bell boy take our luggage to our room. As soon as we entered our room I realised they gave us the wrong room category. This room was tiny- don't bother trying to swing a cat. Reluctantly we had to waste time and go downstairs to sort this out. My husband asked them what room they gave us- instead of telling us the category (classic- avoid unless you're travelling solo) the receptionist replied "let me check what category you booked) He came back with a "oh, we gave you the wrong room). Perhaps i'm cynical but it seems to me that they knew they gave us the wrong room. Back up to the 3rd floor, on to the new room which was slightly bigger. Toiletries were good quality and bath robes and slippers provided but only two bath towels- nothing to dry hair. Two small hand towels but I had to use these as bath mats since the shower (in the bath) spilled water all over the floor after each shower and no bath mats provided. We had no problems with noise despite being on the road side. The pillows were TERRIBLE. Small, square european and lumpy. yuk. Because of our room incident I thought they might send us a glass of wine to aplogise or perhaps a note? I'm not normally fussed with things like this but since they are a boutique hotel- this attention to detail counts and especially since I read one reviewer reporting he didn't like a restaurant recommendation they gave him and in return they apologised by sending a big bottle of Hermes to his room? hmmm. Does make one question some of the reviews. And since it was valentines and Paris- perhaps heart shaped chocolates at turn down? Cocktails at the bar with a valentines twist? Something? Boutique hotel? Anyways, we made our own reservations (i highly recommend restaurant Jamin- 10 minute walk and great food) and the rest of the trip was fine. I was critical with my review but I think all too often (myself included) hotels get bookings based on TA reviews. I think it's only fair then that the negative gets pointed out also for people to be able to make a informed decision. This was an ok hotel. Not bad but not great. Will I stay here again? Probably not. One final point and to end the review on a positive- the breakfast ladies are a real asset to hotel Keppler and run the pretty breakfast room with military precision- well done.

Reviews.Title: “Small, stylish, boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: pbda
Reviews.Content: This superbly located hotel is discreet, with excellent links to transportation. The rooms are very comfortable, and reasonably large for Paris. Furnishings are exquisite, as is the service. You'll need to book early, since there are a limited number of rooms, but the advance planning is well worth it. My "go to" hotel when I'm in Paris on business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jimnem40
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to get an upgraded room, which was a good size (by central city standards!), spotlessly clean, comfortable and beautifully furnished. The communal areas were very stylish yet comfortable. The location of the hotel is great if you want to be close to the Champs Elysee but on a quiet side street. However in hidsight my preference would have probably been to stay on the other side of the river where I found the area to be a bit more interesting.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel in an excellent location, very relaxing and will definitely return again.”
Reviews.Author: GAMPD1997
Reviews.Content: Hotel well situated for all the main attractions. Very relaxing and peaceful. Staff very attentive and extremely helpful. Hotel beautifully decorated and rooms very comfortable and luxurious. A wonderful holiday in a great city, can't wait to return to Paris and te Hotel Keppler.

Reviews.Title: “A tale of two halves”
Reviews.Author: CityBreak84
Reviews.Content: Our experience of Hotel Keppler was mixed to say the least. We went with friends for a 30th birthday and sadly everyone got an upgrade except us! By all accounts their rooms were excellent - spacious and well appointed. We even heard talk about a TV in the bathroom! We were however on the 1st floor which was the smoking floor. Our room was therefore not the most fragant and was also quite small. We did ask to change rooms but there were no non-smoking rooms available which was a shame. Breakfast was good but a bit expensive for what it was. Location was however excellent and the road was nice and quiet so sleeping wasn't a problem. Staff were all very helpful and friendly. So a mixed review and we would return - provided we got a nicer room!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort ,attention to detail and lots of style”
Reviews.Author: Co_MeathIrelandPoppy
Reviews.Content: First time in Paris so we did not know what to expect...The Hotel was a little gem its small but has everything you need including the best attention we have ever had in the Hotel.The staff are so keen to look after you ..we felt special to tell the truth.Well done to the Hotel Keppler we would recommend this Hotel to anyone going on a romantic or sightseeing weekend.Have the breakfast its just what you need with the lovely decor and smiling staff,first thing in the morning.No sour faces here they where glad to see us.The position is perfect for getting around we did all the tourist things.......lets not beat about the bush its expensive in Paris for just about everything but its all done with such panache.The Air France coach from CDG was the best route for us it stops a 6/7 mins walk from the hotel ,so it was painless to get to. Cant wait for the next trip to Paris...will stay in the Keppler for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: paulakurkolarsen
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our experience at Hotel Keppler. The location was perfect with easy access to many sights and the metro. Although the room was a bit small, it was lovely. All of the hotel staff was incredibly helpful. I will stay here again when I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Paris centre hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Martino52
Reviews.Content: Like many Parisienne hotels, the Keppler is small, with small rooms, but completely charming. The decor is stylish, and the ambiance is calm and relaxing. Staff are friendly, helpful and efficient. WiFi is free (larger chain hotels please note!). The only downside, if it is one, is that all room service comes from outside restaurants. This extends the choice, but also the wait time. No big deal. The hotel is so relaxing, it's almost difficult to go out!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: CaroPanda
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Keppler over the Christmas holiday based on TripAdvisor reviews and were not disappointed. The hotel's location is ideal for exploring central Paris. It's literally a block from the Laduree on the Champs-Elysses, which is dangerous if you have a weakness for macarons. Our room was on the smallish side but it was beautifully appointed in modern-ish decor and excellent linens. The bathroom was gorgeous - sleek and spotless. The breakfast room in the basement was cozy and the breakfast itself was generous with a Continental spread, eggs and meats, and delicious pastries. I didn't use the on-site gym, but was pleasantly surprised to learn of its existence. The concierge and staff were top notch. They made excellent recommendations and were eager to help with all of my bookings. I look forward to staying at Hotel Keppler next time I'm in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent French Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BusterBrewsky
Reviews.Content: We booked at Hotel Keppler after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor and seeing it was on the list of hotels that took our travel points. Since staying we have seen it climb up the list of hotels on Trip Advisor. We were very happy. We arrived during the weekend of the final of the Tour de France and shortly before we arrived they asked us if we would stay for a night at their sister hotel, Hotel Francios. In return they upgraded us to a suite with a balcony view of the Eiffle Tower. We left Hotel Francois in the AM and returned to Keppler in the PM to find out luggage conveniently transferred. The suite was beautifully decorated with wonderful amenities. The lobby bar was a nice place to relax after a day of site seeing and the breakfast, included in the price, was very well done and a nice way to start the day. We also enjoyed their sister hotel and it is also worthy of consideration. Both hotels enjoy an excellent location in Paris. As others have said, Keppler is a beautifully decorated modern hotel while its sister hotel is a more traditional french Louis XIV style. If you need the large chain style hotel this wouldn't suit you but if you want a local hotel which pays attention to detail and service, this is an excellent option at a reasonable price for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Perfect Paris”
Reviews.Author: MausieBullCreek
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Keppler as part of our beginning and end journey of Europe. The Hotel was in a perfect location, the staff were very attentive, the lovely breakfast room was cosy, and the breakfast was delightful. Our room was comfortable, a little on the small side, but tastefully decorated and there was no noise to speak of. The downstairs bar and comfortable lounge added to the ambience of the Hotel. Would stay there again. The concierges were helpful in recommending restaurants which we enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Mark R
Reviews.Content: This was a truly great experiance, the Hotel is small, but for us perfectly formed. All the staff that we came into contact with could not have been nicer or more helpful, this included Simon who gave excellent service around the bar! I would also like to mention the member of staff who recommended the excellent restaurant for an evening meal he arranged for us. The decor is beautiful and of a very high spec with everything you need in a Hotel room. A great location for all the sites and the Metro is a 10 min walk away in either direction. A truly "magnifique" small Hotel that we would gladly stay in again and this is our 8th visit to Paris

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: lola2882
Reviews.Content: went there over a long weekend, we rented the suite, it was big enough,i loved the location, i fallen in love with the decor, breakfast is great as well, probably one of the best hotels i have ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous”
Reviews.Author: veryveryfussy
Reviews.Content: the keppler is perfectly located , moments from the Champs Elysee yet quiet and stylish . The staff could not have been more helpful , the decor of the hotel is gorgeous and the rooms spotless and very comfortable . The breakfast was escellent and the the hotel had a nice lounge and bar and a further quiet lounge for quiet reading if required . We would definitely stay here again in fact we wouldn't stay anywhere else in Paris The hotel has approx 30 bedrooms so small enough to offer a good service ,but not too small

Reviews.Title: “New Years Paris”
Reviews.Author: gmebius
Reviews.Content: Beautifull Boiutique Hotel in great location!! Just 2 blocks from Champs Elysees and the Arc de Triumph! We stayed at the Penthouse Suite with our two kids, so it was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Keppler”
Reviews.Author: princeharry
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in November. Great boutique hotel in wonderful location,...on a quiet street just off the Champs Elysee near the Arc de Triomphe. The service was great and very friendly and helpful.Great French breakfasts.Rooms and bathrroms are updated and very clean and modern. Only negative was rooms are a lttle tight but I guess that's what Paris is in that location and price range

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: AmalfiRegina
Reviews.Content: Although I enjoyed our stay here I don't know if I would choose to stay again. Staying this close to the champs Elyse right before Christmas was great for walking and enjoying the Christmas markets but I think I will choose to stay possibly at the keppler's sister hotel on rue St. Germaine this summer when we return. The best thing about the keppler was the breakfast. The staff in the breakfast room were so kind and considerate. Also the staff looking after the bar were very nice to deal with. Reception staff overlooked two things. First, our check in was very rushed and as a result our repurchased wine/cheese in the our room was missed and then our airport transfer was totally messed up. Even though we confirmed the pickup time the day before departure the man reception didn't seem to be concentrating therefore didn't follow thru with the booking. Hence we almost missed our flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & warm, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: SamBed
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a family trip here with our four year old for three nights between Christmas and New Year. Upon our arrival in the early evening they brought warm milk and cookies to our room for our son that we didn't even ask for so we got off to a great start. We had an executive room with a pull-out bed and plenty of space. The hotel is in a very quiet street however really close to several attractions i.e. Champs Elysees, Arc de Triomphe, Eiffel Tower etc. We didn't have the hotel breakfast as 14 euro pp seemed a bit steep, instead we headed to the wonderful Josephine boulangerie/cafe just around the corner. Lovely, chilled ambience in the hotel and we will definitely stay here again for future visits to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: kmrmpl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took the train from London to spend one night in Paris before returning to the UK. When we arrived at the hotel, neither of us were feeling well. The woman working the front desk was incredibly kind and helpful. She asked her colleague to bring us sparkling water with lemon, offered to help with canceling our dinner reservations for the night if needed, pointed out the nearest pharmacy, and even upgraded our rooms (we were I Prefer members which comes with room upgrade when available, but this was a substantial upgrade). This truly exceptional service turned around our whole day. The location of the hotel is excellent. However, you should have the exact hotel address handy if you are taking a cab because not all cab drivers are familiar with the hotel location and it is located on a side street. The common rooms of the hotel are beautifully furnished and decorated. You feel like you are walking into a Parisian couture showroom when you walk into the lobby. Since our stay was so short, we did not have a chance to have breakfast at the hotel or use the fitness center, though the facilities looked very nice. The high end fashion theme is carried through to the design of the hotel rooms. Our room was exceptionally spacious and had a lovely view out across the nearby rooftops -- which felt very Parisian. Suites have walk-in closets, large bathrooms, separate living areas with sofas, and comfy king size beds. We were wowed! Overall, Hotel Keppler is a wonderful boutique hotel that certainly is deserving of all the rave reviews. Thank you for making our short time in Paris, and not-so-great start to the trip, a memorable occasion. We will certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “So close to everything”
Reviews.Author: GnT_xx
Reviews.Content: Spoil yourself! Great room and great service. Very close to George V and Charles de Gaulle Etoille Metro stops. Best access to some iconic Paris sights. Breakfast was excellent and I was surprised to notice how many non-hotel guests had booked in for breakfast. Travelled in Late November 2011 as a couple.

Reviews.Title: “great concierge”
Reviews.Author: Sookt
Reviews.Content: Great service. Arrived early and was put into a small room to 'rest' while they prepared my room for me to move into. Philippe and Vincent did an amazing job helping me with restaurant bookings (Philippe managed to get me a seat at l'ami louis on a saturday night - while Vincent, Philippe and Cedric helped me confirm/book my massive list of restaurants such as LTDA, l'arpege, Taillevent, Pierre gagnaire, Michel Rostang, Atelier Maitre Albert, Les Papilles, l'ami louis and many more...). Very convenient to metro and shopping...

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ADDJ
Reviews.Content: Either Paris is very overrated or we stayed at the wrong hotel. We purchased the Oh So Chic in Paris package that included a suite, free transportation one way, free breakfast and Champagne+amuse bouche. When we arrived we were informed that champange+amuse bouche was going to be offered just once during our stay as opposed to everyday, which was implied on the website. While this fact in itself is not a huge deal, the package details could have been communicated better. When we did receive it, the amuse bouche consisted of Lays Chips and Peanuts...not the quite the French experience we expected. DO NOT order room service. When we decided to stay in one of the nights and ordered room service, the CHICKEN ARRIVED RAW - i repeat - there was blood in the chicken and we didn't get one of the dishes that we ordered. I forgot to mention it only took 1.5hrs...While the suite was nice - we had the view of the Eifel Tower as promised - one of the big annoyances was that the bathroom door locked from the inside when we arrived and we had to wait for the hotel employee to come up with the toolbox to unlock it...not exactly what you want to deal with when you arrive in Paris. Also, if you like to work out this is not the hotel for you, the gym is tiny and has a funky moldy smell. Maybe our expectations were simply too high for Paris and many of the small boutique hotels are like this or worse. The one positive was that the people who work at the hotel are incredibly nice and genuinely try hard to work through all the issues.

Reviews.Title: “Great decor, fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Davids1971
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel Kepler this last weekend after reading trip advisor reviews and it surpassed already high expectations. The room was exquisite, very clean and comfortable and chic, the location was excellent, strolling distance to champs élysées, eiffel tower etc etc By what we would highly recommend was the service, helpful, knowledgeable and friendly with nothing too much trouble - from what restaurant to go to, to what burlesque show to visit I cannot recommend it highly enough All in all - we loved the hotel and it's helpful and professional service And would highly recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Cedric and Philippe are the best!!”
Reviews.Author: Drew M
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I got engaged on our trip to Paris last month. We spent a whole week at the Hotel Keppler, and everything was PERFECT. Cedric and Philippe helped us with all of our reservations, booked us taxis, and went above and beyond to make sure we had a great trip. Stay at the Keppler. You wont regret it!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with excellent service and well appointed rooms”
Reviews.Author: EmmaLovesaHoliday83
Reviews.Content: Amazing location Beautiful hotel Amazing service Lovely breakfast (they even made up a tray for my boyfriend and took it up to me as I wasnt feeling well) Rooms were a little on the small side but it didn't ruin the stay at all. Lovely bathroom especially the roomy shower with savoy shower head.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay.”
Reviews.Author: DonTutto
Reviews.Content: This hotel's location makes you feel like you live in Paris. In a residential area, it's away from the hustle and bustle of the tourist areas, yet close to everything. Just a couple of blocks from a Metro station and the Champs-Elysee. And the staff makes you feel at home. Do make sure you get an interior room as the street can be a bit noisy. All in all we had a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel”
Reviews.Author: fmck49
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Keppler for 4 nights. The classic rooms are compact and so probably a bit too small for couples but we had them as singles and they were perfect - very well appointed and very comfortable. They both overlooked an inner courtyard so were also very quiet. I slept much better than I usually do in hotels. Breakfast is 22 euros but fortunately was included in our room rate as it is quite a nice buffet but not worth nearly that much. The concierge and other staff are all very helpful and friendly - nothing was too much trouble, e.g. recommending and booking restaurants, organising taxis. The hotel is 5 minutes walk from George V Metro and the Champs-Elysees so a perfect base for sightseeing and there are lots of good restaurants within walking distance. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again or to recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel steps from Champs-Elysees”
Reviews.Author: jbulloch
Reviews.Content: We chose the Keppler based on the reviews from Trip Advisor and we were happy we did. The hotel was modern, stylish and close to everything in and around the Arc de Triomphe. The reception was excellent both from the bellman and the front desk. We arrived at 13:15 and our charming room awaited us. Because the hotel was small, the staff acknowledged us each time we passed through the common rooms. We felt like privileged guests. Like most Paris hotel rooms ours was small for the rate charged. This goes with the territory, but it was comfortable and didn't feel too restrictive. Breakfast was an excellent value and the elegant lobby bar was available for late night drinks.

Reviews.Title: “High expectations met perfectly!”
Reviews.Author: SpartanGrad52000
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel Keppler after reading every review for the 8th and 1st arrs (our target area for high end locations, close to shopping, museums and attractions) and it met every expectation. This boutique hotel was everything we hoped: a high-end Sofitel-quality and service with a personal touch. We selected the concierge pick-up at CDG so we didn't have to think about a thing after a sleepless red-eye flight from NYC as well as the car service to/from the airport (the options appear at the confirmation page when you book online.) Worth every penny! We also chose the breakfast option with our "executive room king" given all the rave reviews, but we thought the food was just ok. It became more of a chore to be sure we got up in time given our jet-lag than it was was probably worth. Overall, the Trip Advisor community hit the nail on the head, yet again. 5's across the board! Merci beaucoup!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Keppler”
Reviews.Author: Fema6301
Reviews.Content: All that We expected and more!! Great service and very helpful staff. Thanks to Cedric and phillipe!

Reviews.Title: “What a great find ! Friendly & Warm”
Reviews.Author: TheSaters
Reviews.Content: Just spent a weekend in Paris and stayed at this great hotel which we found on the internet. The room size was small, but very coszy and homey. The staff were very attentive to our needs and gave good advice about the various things we asked for. The compleimentary boat tour tickets was a very nice touch which we made use of. The hotel is a short walk from the ChampsElyees and the Siena river which is great. We would definitely return to it !

Reviews.Title: “Review for Hotel Keppler”
Reviews.Author: NFsailor
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 days in Paris. Stayed at the Hotel Keppler. It was outstanding. We have no hesitation recommending this hotel. Right up there with one of the nicest hotel we have ever stayed at. Room was not huge but adequate in every way. The staff were extremely helpful in recommending restaurants and very interested in our daily feedback. Breakfast was excellent. We would definitely recommend this hotel and stay there again. J&B, Oakville, ON, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Trois jours escapade”
Reviews.Author: soopurr
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in a Standard room which was just perfect for us, especially as we were out all day and in the evenings. The room was at the front of the hotel on the second floor and we slept with the windows open, as the room was quite warm and the air conditioning was not available. That said, street noise was minimal and just the occasional disturbance but you are going to get that in a city. The room's decor was impeccable and very clean, which leads me to the bed - so comfortable. Again the bathroom was spotlessly clean with plenty of toiletries that are restocked each day. The room was very relaxing - perfect after all the walking we did and loved the small touches (turn down service & classical music playing on our return in the evening). The staff were all friendly, polite, well informed and nothing was too much trouble and because of them ended up having the best meal of our stay at a restaurant called Jamin. The location is perfect and the nearest metro is George V, however, we just ended up walking everywhere, as there is so much to see and you really do get a feel for the city (another plus to help aching feet is the hotels sauna/steam - delightful). The hotel is situated in a up market area and therefore, you will be paying premium prices if you stay in the locality for meals etc. All I can say is explore and look out for where the locals eat - usually cheaper and very good. We found a small place nearby in Rue Francois called Cafe O, where we had fresh coffee and croissants etc for around ten euros. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel and look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really Good Hotel! Great Staff especially Symon the barmen!”
Reviews.Author: Maniacnumber1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in the most basic room which is adequate if you are out exploring all day. Our room faced the street and got a little noisy at times but all in all was pretty comfortable. If I were to return to Paris I am not sure I would stay in this area again, mainly due to the prices of everything close by - if you live in London the Champs Elysees area offers nothing spectaculor or any shopping bargains really - other than Sephora which we no longer have! I would reccomend staying somewhere more bohemian and getting to the attactions by metro as I found the metro to be the only thing value for money! We did not eat breakfast at the hotel but it seemed expensive at 32 euros for a buffet, Josephines around the corner looked amazing but is closed weekends. The Spa downstairs is an added bonus for a relax - the gym is compact but looked good. The concierge were great and reccomend good places to eat for any budget, the real highlight of this place is the lovely Symon (from Sri Lanka) behind the bar in the evenings, he could not do enough for everyone - we even saw him go and get some guest a takeaway! I would reccomend this hotel for anyone wanting to stay in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Fall Getaway”
Reviews.Author: TJBII
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this boutique hotel for a week. Our room was still being prepared upon our arrival and we were treated with a cold drink. The hotel was beautifully decorated by a top French designer and looks totally new. It is walking distance the Champs Elysee, Arc de Triomphe, Eiffel Tower and Louvre. The Metro and taxis are nearby. There are many boutiques and cafes nearby and this is a very safe, clean area of Paris. The staff was very helpful, knowledgeable and professional. The hotel is immaculately clean. We highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Keppler: C'est Chic!”
Reviews.Author: Serial_Traveller
Reviews.Content: It's very hard to not repeat what's already been written, but I was truly surprised at how pleasant the Hotel Keppler was. I would definitely state that this charming boutique hotel was actually one of the few highlights of our stay in Paris, and I we wouldn't hesitate to return to this establishment. We took the Executive room and I don't think I can fault it. Yes, it's still a bit small, but ALL hotel rooms in Paris are small unless you're staying in a new modern building.  Certainly you can only have 1 person in the bathroom at a time, but it's still well designed and I loved the shiny black soft PVC (?) walls. What did stand out for us was the charming young handsome Frenchman on the front desk who took time marking up maps and finding addresses for our rather specific itinerary. And I also think a big credit must go to the charming Asian couple who run the breakfast room. Absolutely loved going to, and lingering over, breakfast. A great start to the day, and no rushing or being kicked out early. Many hotels could learn from their attitude. The hotel has been awarded a 4 star rating - and that's an honest rating. But in my opinion it gets 5 out of 5 for providing an excellent 4 star rated hotel - and it certainly beats many a 5 star rated property we've stayed at. All in all, how very refreshing to find a unique boutique hotel that surpasses expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little haven!”
Reviews.Author: Moley2222
Reviews.Content: My husband took me here for my birthday, which prompted a room upgrade in this wonderful little gem. The staff bent over backwards to make our stay personal and memorable. We will definitely return next time we are in Paris. Thank you, Hotel Keppler staff, all of you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: Flycasterwa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Keppler for four nights, the stay kicked off a 2.5 week trip through Europe and we found it to be a fantastic start. Upon arrival we were warmly greeted by the staff. Beautiful warm lobby, very comfortable, first impressions were great. Our room was not yet ready which was fine, we were also offered a upgrade which was a pleasant surprise. We were offered breakfast, which we accepted and we were escorted downstairs to the breakfast room. Staff there was also welcoming, selections were fantastic and food was very good. When done we were introduced to our room. We found it to be very comfortable and bright. Nice amenities (Hermes), robes slippers, etc. Location for us was also very good. First night we walked to and strolled the Seine, and Tour Eiffel. Very close to all major Metro stations. To summarize we found Hotel Keppler to be comfortable, convenient, and welcoming. Highly recommend. BTW we stayed at Jay's the last visit which is also highly recommended on trip advisor. We saw the biggest difference being the size of the room, which lets face it for a couple is not a big deal, at least for us. And we saved $$.

Reviews.Title: “Small but beautiful.”
Reviews.Author: SouthportMandyb
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Keppler and were greeted in a warm,friendly manner. The porter showed us up to our room which was a standard double,although it was a kingsize bed. Although the room may have been on the small side it was cosy,stylish with quality furnishings and contained everything we may have possibly needed. The attention to detail was superb. Plenty of coat hangars, full length mirror, toiletries, shoe cleaning, bath robes, mini bar, proper hairdryer the list goes on. The bathroom was well thought out and a bigger than average size with a shower cubicle as well as a full size bath. Breakfast was buffet style and again lacked for nothing. A definite revisit on the cards.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at the George 5, stay at Hotel Keppler!”
Reviews.Author: Jillpytosh
Reviews.Content: Our family, (my husband and three boys) stayed in their gorgeous 2 bedroom/two bath penthouse suite. While there was no balcony in room 602, there was plenty of room for everyone to spread out and have proper down time (and still great views). The linens and bed were amazing, the bathrooms very clean and roomy, the service was fabulous, breakfast (not included for the adults) delish - get the hot chocolate for the kids, and we had just the right amount of walking from the metro. This is a great hotel for the kids but I can also say that it would also be lovely for just adults. I have stayed at other Hotels in Paris but really want to return to the Keppler. Good job and thank you for such a nice experience. I will say for the money you are better off with the 2 bed/2bath at the Keppler instead of the George 5 or the Bristol, Ritz etc. Did I mention quiet?

Reviews.Title: “Great location & Service in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Jazzy501
Reviews.Content: Seems redundant to write another glowing review here but this hotel is a boutique gem. It has an amazing location with great chic cafes nearby, steps to Champs Elysees and not far from the Eifflel tower. We didn't book a rate with breakfast but went out every morning.... after all, we were in Paris. Why did we want to stay cooped up in the hotel? Cafe Angelina was our regular haunt whilst in Paris. We craved their hot chocolate like a drug. A shot each morning just to start the day on a perfect note! Our room was pretty, clean and comfortable. Overall, a very pleasant boutique hotel experience in Paris although we found the room rather tight, small and a little restrictive. A little more space would have been appreciated. Despite this, we had a great time largely due to the flawless service at the hotel. Worth a visit!

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DCSadie
Reviews.Content: From before we even arrived, we felt taken care of! The two concierges, Philipe and Cedric were extremely helpful making restaurant reservations and helping us skip the lines at all the museums. The hotel is in a fantastic location, just off the Champs Elysees, yet completely quiet. Staying in a boutique hotel made our trip so much more enjoyable than staying in one of the huge tourist hotels. Our room had a small balcony, and we made espresso from the handy little machine in the room and sat and enjoyed the view of the Eiffel Tower! We loved this hotel and can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “A true Gem”
Reviews.Author: westiemen
Reviews.Content: As good as the hotel looks on the website the actual experience far exceeds anything a picture can convey.The hotel has a sophisticated yet inviting feel about it. The public rooms draw you in to sit and relax and have a glass of wine. Our suite 601 had a 17ft. private terrace with a great view of the Eiffel Tower and the gold topped Church of the Dome.The suite was like a chic Pied a terre. The design makes you book the hotel but it is the staff that will ensure your return.Cedric, Philippe,Annabelle and the manager Francois made the stay even more memorable with a freindly conversation, a restaurant suggestion or revervation, always taking the time to accomodate your request.The cleaning staff are also to be comended as are the breakfast staff. It felt like your were staying at a private club and not a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - great staff”
Reviews.Author: Raoul_King_of_Spain
Reviews.Content: Lives up to the high ratings here, due in large part to the location, styling and staff. Very intimate lobby area with inviting places to sit and rest. Nice breakfast dining room with a very attentive staff and good breakfast. Location is great for exploring, yet off the busy thoroughfares making it a pleasant place to sleep and unwind from the busy streets a few blocks away. Several good small cafes and pastry shops nearby and easy walking access to major attractions. As with many hotels, the staff makes the difference and the Hotel Keppler excels here. Always willing to suggest places, make dinner and rail reservations and print custom walking maps, it is obvious the staff (Cedric, Phillipe) is aware of how much they matter to the hotel and work hard to impress. Rooms are Paris small, but made up for by wonderful furnishings and a nice bathroom. Overall, a great choice in a boutique hotel that offers a great location near the action and a warm, engaging staff.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to be in Paris”
Reviews.Author: O_S_15
Reviews.Content: After reading this hotel's remarkable reviews we have decided to book a 6 night stay, although our budget was originally lower. We had very high expectations, and now we know we had a good reason for that. We had such a pleasant stay a the Keppler - the rooms are so tasteful, beautifully decorated and comfortable. The area is very quiet and calm, yet very close to Champs-Elysees, Arc de Triumph (5 min by foot) and the Eiffel Tower (15 min by foot). There are 2 Metro stations located 5 min walk from the hotel. Breakfast was delicous, and was served in a marvelous dining room. The lobby is truely a piece of art - just sitting there with a glass of champagne is a moment to remember. The hotel staff is so helpful and friendly, and deserve every compliment. We certainly look forward to our next visit,,,

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantasic”
Reviews.Author: Hannah747
Reviews.Content: Visiting Paris for the first time, I researched many hotels. After reading glowing reviews of the Hotel Keppler, I booked a 5 night stay. I was delighted upon entering the hotel by the beautiful decor in the lobby area, and that feeling only increased when the door to my room was opened. So impeccably appointed and a nice size. But the best part of this hotel is not just the lovely rooms, lobby, breakfast area, and flowers. It is the friendly staff, and most helpful, knowledgeable and eager to please concierges. If you like boutique hotels, this is the choice for you. Absolutely fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Who says size matters?? This hotel is just fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_V_Toombs
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in this hotel, the first back in 2008 was so good that we were really hoping we wouldn't be disappointed this time - and we weren't! Sure, the rooms are tiny, but that's kind of what you expect in Paris, and they more than make up for it in style. The breakfast is fabulous - something we missed out on last time as we were Room Only. We were also given a complimentary glass of champagne on arriving as returning guests which was a nice touch. Other than that, the location is perfect, 5 mins walk from at least a couple of metro stations, the arc de T and 15 mins amble to eiffel tower - what more could you ask for? Price wise, all I can say is shop about... some sites are definitely better value than others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but severely overpriced for the tiny rooms.”
Reviews.Author: JetsetterATS
Reviews.Content: We love boutique hotels and stumbled upon this one as we planned our Paris and French Riveriera trip. Paris is one of the most expensive cities. Finding a nice hotel that is reasonably priced is basically impossible. We didn't mind spending a bit extra and got a nice deal for this one. The pros: 1. free wireless 2. 5 minute walk to the arc and champs d'elysee; and metro 3. comfy bed 4. cute lounge area. 5. front desk person was very helpful and kind. The cons: 1. TINY. could barely walk without tripping over the bed. 2. essentially no view, unless looking into a building counts. 3. breakfast was surprsingly disappointing. limited options and quite bland. 4. price. ouch. we got a beautiful palace with all the bells and whistles for a LOT less than we paid for in the south of france. obviously we understand the price difference but this wasn't worth the extra.

Reviews.Title: “Treat Yourself to a Fabulous Boutique Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PassionateTraveller2
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at Hotel Kepplar in Paris, for one week this July. It actually exceeded our expectations! This boutique hotel is beautifully appointed and tastefully decorated from the lobby and lounge to the comfortable rooms (it was like sleeping in our own beds) with lovely bathrooms. Although most of our previous rooms in other hotels have been very small, we found this one to be just what we needed. The breakfast room was very bright and made us feel like we were sitting in a garden. All of our concierges as well as the staff were extremely helpful. We looked forward to the delicious buffet breakfast (absolutely everything we needed and then some) every morning! Not only was the food tasty and well presented, the breakfast staff was the best we have ever experienced throughout Europe!! With a smile on their faces, they could not do enough to meet our every need. Sometimes we actually thought they could read our minds! Overall, it was a great way to end our vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent introduction to Paris”
Reviews.Author: RichelleAnne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I started our 2 month honeymoon in Pais at the Keppler. We could not speak more highly about the hotel and the service provided. As this was our first time in France we were a little nervous about getting around due to not speaking the launguage. The front of house staff were extreamly helpful in makin all bookings at attractions and restaurants. The staff are truly a credit to this establishment. The concierge ever ot us a table at guy savoy that I had found to be impossible previously. The rooms are small but beautiful and we appreciated the quiet the hotel provided. The bar downstairs in wonderful, serviced by a lovely gentleman that was always very gracious. Thank you keppler for helping us fall in love in and with Paris.

Reviews.Title: “excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: 18Octave
Reviews.Content: Located at the very center of Paris, just a couple of minutes walk from the Champs Elysees, it is the perfect location makes it the perfect place to stay. Very beautiful, cosy, tasteful decoration, very descent breafast buffet. Two things to look after. the first is that certain rooms (overlooking the inside part of the building) are very small. The second would only interesting if anyone wants to have a car during the stay in Paris. In the hotel site it is mentioned that a parking is available upon request. I called to check availability and I got a verbal confirmation that I would have a place at a daily rate of 30 euro. As soon as I arrived, I was informed that the hotel has only ONE parking place and it was already occupied by someone else!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful stay at Hotel Keppler!”
Reviews.Author: T1berious
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to say this Hotel was great, the room was a good size (for France) and the staff were friendly and attentive. Best of all the room air con was virtually silent! Location was a brilliant for the Champs Élysées and Arc de Triomphe, not cheap but very good none the less, would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel so close to the best attractions in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: SkolVikings
Reviews.Content: Great quiet location just blocks off the Champs and Arc de Triumph. Easy walk to Eifel tower and Seine river walk and attractions. Easy walk down Champs to the Louvre. Very close to metro and bus stations and the airport bus stop. Very friendly, helpful and informative staff. Very nice rooms with nice beds, great bathrooms and showers. It was helpful to book a rate with included breakfast, which was nice with eggs, sausages, bacon, pastries, juices, cheese, meats, etc... lovely. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great personal touch”
Reviews.Author: Andrea44sg
Reviews.Content: It is really a beautiful hotel with great location. I enjoy the stay there. I am really grateful towards the staff as I did get really sick during the trip, I actually fainted in a resturant. As the hotel had made the reservation for us, the hotel was informed. One hotel staff was send to check how I was and what help they could offer me and my husband. Luckily in a foreign land, ayou really need all the help you can get. Because of the incident, we were not be able to take the train out the very next morning, the hotel staff tried to help us, suggested a few alternatives and call the hotel, which we were going to. I am really thankful of the extra miles they tried to go.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and staff!”
Reviews.Author: Swiss2050
Reviews.Content: We just spent three days in Paris and were lucky enough to book the Keppler based on the good reviews here. The hotel was amazing. The common areas were spotless, the rooms were perfect and very decent sized for Paris. The breakfast was great as well. The best thing though was the staff.. My parents had never been to Paris before and had many questions about various things to do. They were blown away by how friendly everyone at the Keppler was, from the check in, to the bellman, the breakfast crew and especially Cedric the concierge. They all went out of their way to make it a very special trip. Definitely would stay there again based on the people!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: ruby1971
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. The interior design team have done an amazing job with the decor. I know a few people have commented on the size of the rooms but the executive room was very comfortable and more than adequate in size. The bathrooms are lovely. The breakfast room was a little small and occasionally you had to wait on a table but the staff worked hard to arrange tables. The location was fantastic for exploring the city. Everyone was very helpful. This is a very elegant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good, with a couple of hiccups”
Reviews.Author: azmad0c
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here with the wife and kids, 9+11. We had adjoining, though not connected rooms. One was upgraded to a suite to keep us close and because on of the elevators was not working for the first day or so. Location: Great. Right off the champs elysees near the Arc de Triomph. Rooms: Well appointed. Our suite had a balcony overlooking rue Keppler. Unfortunately it was cool and wet while we were there. The lounge area is lovely and is a great place to have cocktails or just relax. Staff: Big props to Shyman(?sp), the bartender/porter, who took excellent care of us. Some front desk staff were quite helpful, some seemed more disinterested or rushed. Some of this may have been my language barrier. One day our rooms weren't cleaned until 5pm, which irked me. Morning breakfast has a small buffet with meats, cheeses, eggs, fruit, cereals and yogurt along with coffee and juice all in a very nice setting. It was roughly $25 per person. Overall, I'd recommend the Hotel Keppler more to adutls and couples as opposed to traveling families with younger kids.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: alouise06
Reviews.Content: Took a friend to Paris for her first trip there and this was a perfect place to stay. Location was very central and the hotel was finished to a high standard. Room was clean and comfortable, not sure about the need for a tv on the bathroom mirror - especially in this position! Breakfast was included and a good start to each day. Would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience from start to finish.”
Reviews.Author: JMaguire67
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this beautiful hotel with my Mum and younger brother. The location is fantastic (5 minutes walk from the Champs Elysees but on a lovely, quiet street) and it really is a hidden gem. We arrived at 2pm and were offered a free upgrade to a deluxe suite if we could wait until 5.30pm. In the meantime, they gave us access to lovely shower and change facilities in the gym area so we could freshen up. Every member of staff we encountered during our stay was professional, friendly and couldn't have been more helpful. The suite itself was stunning - living room area with sofa bed, separate bedroom and gorgeous bathroom with jacuzzi bath and separate shower. The large balcony also had a picture perfect view of the Eiffel Tower! Breakfast was ideal - hot cooked food, pastries, bread, cereal, fresh fruit, etc. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Unique boutique hotel in an incredible city”
Reviews.Author: motowninchapelhill
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel keppler bases on the opinions of other tripadvisor reviewers. I prefer boutique hotels to chains. While this hotel was out of the way for me (and my meetings, which were all near the Opera Bastille, it was an easy Line 1 metro ride out there. The nearest metro Station is George V and is a few blocks away. The hotel is completely tucked away on a small side street. Be prepared for your taxi driver NOT to know the hotel or the street. Bring the address. You are greeted by nice young men. As I was turned around and we sat at reception, my guy said my name and pulled up my reaervation without me even asking. I found out later he snuck a peek at my luggage tag. I stayed in a classic room. And it was just fine for me. Clean, new modern and comfortable. The room was quite small by US standards but spacious in Parisian terms. They gave me free wifi for all three of my electronic devices. I'd definitely stay there again. The hotel seems to be set up for business travelers and couples.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious comfort and excellent service in the heart of Champs-Elysees”
Reviews.Author: JaxBeachEd
Reviews.Content: Spacious rooms by European standards, with a comfortable bed and large bathroom. Staff was extremely helpful, providing solid recommendations on dining and destinations. On a quiet street where most buildings are occupied by offices. There was construction going on a couple of buildings down, but it didn't bother us a bit. Rooms were very quiet and A/C worked great. Free WiFi was nice. TV was rather small and picture was fuzzy, but we didn't come to Paris to watch TV. It's a bit of a hike to the nearest Metro station so you might want to take a cab if you have lots of luggage. Our rate included free pick-up or drop-off from train station or airport, plus breakfast, which was excellent. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exclusive hotel in Central Paris”
Reviews.Author: Richmond-VA-Barb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an excellent choice for those wanting a central Paris location with a quiet address. This hotel is a small boutique hotel with a modern French feel. We had a suite and a double room linked by a private foyer. Both were tastefully furnished and decorated in a classic style (see pictures on their site – they are current and accurate). The rooms were a very reasonable size and the bathrooms were generous and well appointed. The hotel has two lobby areas served by a single bar. They are modern in style and the service was excellent. The location is very quiet - you would never know you were within a remarkably short walk to the Arc de Triomphe. They do not have an onsite restaurant and room service is from a local restaurant. We wanted to go out to dinner one evening at aprox 8:30 and they sent us to the same restaurant that they get room service from (Oscar Restaurant - 6 Rue Chaillot). The concierge called ahead and got us reservations. It was a quick walk and the food was the best we had in Paris and reasonably priced. The bartender was returning dishes from room service and walked with us and introduced us to the staff (see reviews on Oscar). The concierge does check in and answered questions. The welcome was a reserved French welcome – vs- the warm and more genuine welcome we received at the hotel (Capital Hotel) in England. It was not cold at all - just different. I did not see any children and the majority of clients seemed to be on business or couples. I would not recommend this hotel if you are traveling with children. This hotel is expensive and you get quality accommodations with the setting and exclusive feel that matches this.

Reviews.Title: “A stylish and comfortable retreat”
Reviews.Author: bron_dan
Reviews.Content: My first ever stay in Paris was an unforgettable experience and it all began with the hotel. The location was excellent - off the main drag on a quiet street, but walking distance to Des Champs-Elysees. We were greeted by very friendly (and English speaking) staff who were courteous and helpful for the duration of our stay. The hotel lobby was magnificently decorated with plenty of comfortable sitting areas where you can sip champagne and nibble on delicious morsels whilst reviewing your days shopping or sightseeing. A real feast for the eyes! Our room was comfortable and equally as stylish with everything we needed. I loved having my bed turned down every night and a note left with tomorrows weather. (very helpful for planning outfits!) After a busy day it really was like coming home - so tranquil and welcoming. I wont stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great location; wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Ardis_11
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. The room we stayed in was small but well appointed. The staff is attentive and they go out of their way to make your stay pleasant. They got tickets for us for any site or museum we wanted to visit and gave us insider tips about what entrance to use. This saved us HOURS of not standing in line. The location is perfect - near l'Arc de Triomphe, the Eiffel Tower, the Seine, the Champs Elsysee. We will definitely stay here on return trips.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kevoSydneyAustralia
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed for 7 nights in an Executive room and the size was adequate. However, not a lot of hanging space in the cupboard, and the cupboard door would not open fully because it opened against the bed. Also, not much room to put our luggage. Room however was nicely decorated and bright, looking out onto a courtyard. The bathroom was quite small and the hot water took some time to come through after the taps were turned on. As well, there was a rather large hanging light in the bathroom which I always hit when drying myself. The TV ser into the bathroom mirror was a very nice touch and the toiletries were top class. Reception and lounge area were very attractive. The buffet breakfast was superb, and served in a lovely bright breakfast room. The breakfast room staff were all very friendly and always remembered if you wanted tea or a great cappucinno. All of the staff, Annabelle in Reservations and Cedric and Phillipe the Concierges, were very friendly and extremely helpful with any requests. However, a couple of the recommended restaurants were quite expensive and we found some excellent good value ones nearby. Two metro stations are nearby, as is a stop for the Hop On Hop Off bus. Othwise, there is not a lot of atmosphere about the area around the Hotel. We would definitely recommend this Hotel to anyone who wishes to stay in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Another lovely stay at the Keppler”
Reviews.Author: tiffabits
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Keppler once, we returned for another trip, this time in the Executive Room. Last time we found the hotel well appointed, but the rooms a little small. This time, the room was lovely, and the appointments still great. Philippe and Cedric, the concierges, are simply fabulous. The breakfast is very pleasant, and of high quality. Perhaps the only slight criticisms would be that the beds are not the "most" comfortable I have ever slept in (but not bad, but any stretch), and the air-conditioning is a little timid. I have already booked another stay at the Keppler, having been back only a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: wnn33
Reviews.Content: We traveled from Boston to celebrate my wife's 30th Birthday and stayed 5 nights at the Keppler. We loved everything about it. We had the Standard room because it was the only room available when we booked. Yes, the room was small but it was very comfortable and nicely appointed. We loved the rainfall shower. The staff couldn't have been more helpful in suggesting restaurants, making reservations, calling taxis, and generally pointing us in the right direction. We thought the location was perfect. The Metro was a short 3 or 4 block walk from the Keppler and made it easy to get wherever we wanted to go. We can't wait to make it back to the Keppler!

Reviews.Title: “too romantic..........”
Reviews.Author: katrinSchattendorf
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend surprised me with a proposal followed by a weekend in Paris in this hotel. It was perfect for the occation! amazing room! Lovely view.... Very good location. Very nice and helpful staff. the best choice!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Hotel Keppler”
Reviews.Author: mcrimi
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful stay at the Keppler. This is a very stylish boutique hotel that lives up to its reputation. Service was excellent, due in no small part to the management team of Francois, the Manager, Cedric, the Concierge, and Annabel, who just made everything pleasant. All of the staff was helpful, maids and bellmen included. Personal and sincere, you feel like a long time guest. The room was stylish and well appointed. I took pictures so I may design a bedroom/bath this way for my own home. Real quality linens, matress, and bathroom fixtures are what makes the room stand out. I'm not a fan of contemporary decor, but the rooms are really elegant. The location is very good for a right bank hotel, a few blocks from the "Champs". However, there is not a cabdriver in Paris who knows the "Rue Keppler", most insisting this Americain is meaning " Rue Kleber". Not. Perfect? No. The hotel is a boutique, with the pluses and miuses that go with. Rooms a little small, a sidestreet location that is difficult to park in front, no grand reception rooms, very small gym, no restaurant...but we loved it anyway. On our last night I asked the concierge for a restaurant recomendation, which my wife didn't like. I told him so when we returned, and recieved a sincere apology. A few minutes later a bellman appeared at our door with a large box, containing a large bottle of Hermes perfume. Thats service!

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional hotel”
Reviews.Author: JimR0
Reviews.Content: This was the first trip to Paris for my wife and me. We spent five nights. From the moment you walk in the door until the time you leave you feel that you are visiting friends, You get to know most of the small staff. The staff is totally accomodating whether it be making dinner reservations or giving suggestions where you might buy certain items. The rooms are beautifully decorated and maintained in impecable fashion. Here is an example of how caring the staff was. After we checked out and were waiting for our taxi, one of the staff came over to us and offered to get us something to drink while we were waiting.

Reviews.Title: “Small and friendly luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: hanord
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here with our daughter for three nights. We had read many great reviews about the hotel and had high expectations. The hotel exceeded our expectations. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was great. The rooms and decoration was impeccable. We've stayed at many large luxury chains such as Four Seasons and Ritz, but this was an even better experience. Next time we're in Paris we're coming back to Keppler.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Buzzamia
Reviews.Content: Our small family of 3 just return from Paris and the Hotel Keppler was a big part of our enjoyment. The hotel is beautiful, the decor was elegant and classic. We had a suite, and yes the rooms are small, but it was still very comfortable. And though we were in a busy location, the noise level was minimal. Our balony view of the Eiffel tower was a highlight for us all. The staff was superb, extremely helpful, friendly and accomadating. Their help in suggestions for restaurants and directions on trains was so helpful. We had the breakfast plan and it was excellent and definitely satisfied my 15 yr. old growning son. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jezza_11
Reviews.Content: Hotel had extremely friendly and helpful staff. Concierge had excellent knowledge of tourist sites and were always happy to assist or make recommendations. Room was beautifully decked out and very well cleaned every day. Being located right near the Arc de Triomphe and close to bus/metro made it easy to sightsee. Breakfast was always lovely. Hotel has a well decked out lounge and bar area. No restaurant in hotel, but can order in from room service menu, and nice restaurants nearby. Loved everything about our stay here, except having to leave.

Reviews.Title: “The Keppler Gets it Right!”
Reviews.Author: ChoosyAussie
Reviews.Content: It's almost impossible to fault the Keppler. We first stayed here when it was a 2-star establishment and the refurbishment must be seen to be believed. Today's Keppler is simply first rate. From the moment you are welcomed and shown to your stylish room, to the most comfortable bed on the planet (with brilliant pillows) to the excellent breakfasts with attentive yet never intrusive service, it's understandable why this hotel is almost always booked out.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: s0upb0ne
Reviews.Content: My first time in Paris and I cannot say enough about this hotel. The staff at this hotel are incredible professionals. Very knowledgeable and intent on you not having a bad stay at their hotel. From general small talk to making reservations, I really enjoyed my stay. We stayed in an executive room during our stay. The room has a king bed and the size of the room is comparable to NYC sized hotel rooms. The bathroom is large and well appointed. The room has a view of the inner court yard and is quiet as a museum. It is an easy walk to the Champs-Elysees and several Metro stops. The location is somewhat residential, but we loved that aspect. We did a side trip to Burgundy and came back for one night on the way back to the US and they upgraded us to s suite. Balcony view has view over the Paris rooftops and the Eiffel Tower. I will say it again - What really makes this hotel is the staff. There may be better rooms in Paris, but not better service.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice interior decoration”
Reviews.Author: pricklypoppy
Reviews.Content: Likes: Absolutely immaculate housekeeping Beautiful fabrics and light fixtures Nice linens Comfortable bed, feather pillows Marble bathroom Quiet Helpful front desk, will easily speak English with you if you want it Elegant and intimate lobby Within walking distance to the l'Arc de Triomphe Accomodating with the in-room breakfast, the staff included enough food for 3 teens In-room climate control Dislikes: Not too close to the metro Tip: Upgrade to the Executive room because there is not enough space for luggage in the Double

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Engagement”
Reviews.Author: gnordin
Reviews.Content: The service at Hotel Keppler was beyond excellent. I had never encountered such a helpful concierge desk. I had planned a surprise proposal on the Pon Des Arts bridge and the concierge helped me pick the restaurant to make the night perfect. The room was elegant and small as to be expected. The location was fabulous and only a couple blocks from the subway and Champs-Elysées. The hotel was very small and it was fun meeting the other guests in the lobby over a glass of wine before everyone departed for dinner each night. The hotel also had a nice fireplace seating area to keep us warm after coming in on cold nights. Truly a gem of a hotel in a great location. Very romantic.

Reviews.Title: “1st class from check in to check out”
Reviews.Author: AliStu092
Reviews.Content: Visit Paris in April 2011 to celebrate my wife’s birthday and opted to stay at Hotel Keppler after reading the positive reviews on Trip Advisor. Our whole experience of Paris was excellent (although I was sceptical about going), and was set of right from the start by the friendly welcome we received at Hotel Keppler. At check in we were asked what we were interested in seeing and given a Paris map with instructions of how to get to the many sights in Paris. We were encouraged to ask the staff if we wanted to book a restaurant, show, boat trips, etc. This was something that we took them up on, and the staff booked The Moulin Rouge on our behalf. Positives: Individuality of the hotel and the décor Helpfulness and friendliness of all the staff Location (3 min walk to the Metro), in the heart of the city Standard of the bedrooms (not that small for a city centre Hotel) Breakfast of a high standard and attentive staff Negatives: None that I can think of, however it is not for those travelling on a tight budget I would recommend this Hotel to anyone that wants to experience and explore Paris. We will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem - keep it a secret ...”
Reviews.Author: ohashem1
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying in the hotel or two nights one on the way to another city and one on the way back home, in my first stay, i was assigned an executive room, beautiful room, small but yet beautiful, great attentive staff, small reception, but the whole hotel is 39 rooms, so that's what you should expect. On my way back I was given the junior suite, simply outstanding, great small junior suite, room 601, beautiful balcony, with a view of the Eiffel tower, the bath is great, the bed sleep quality is outstanding, quite factor is magnificent. The staff are super courteous and helpful, they managed restaurant booking like clock work, a hidden gem in Paris, I would highly recommend for couples who what to enjoy Paris with style.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: hULLpOPPY
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights with my husband and daughter. The hotel was easy to find a short walk away from the Metro. The room was very clean and tidy albeit a little small. The bathroom was amazing with a built in tv in the bathroom mirror! Every night we had chocolates, water and information about the weather left in our room. The breakfast was wonderful the staff couldn't do enough it was absolutely spotless a sheer pleasure. My only complaint would be that there were no facilities in the room for making tea/coffee, but you could purchase coffee from the bar downstairs. Wonderful stay, I would highly recommend this hotel and would I would not hesitate to use this hotel again when next visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “I love This hotel”
Reviews.Author: Winata
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel has excellent decoration, from the furnitures, the lightings, they are flawless. The staff also very friendly, they help you a lot. What i love about this hotel is you can smoke inside the room (maybe only applied to certain room but they have it). Location is very near to champ elysee. Nice hotel, nice staff, compare to price, yes it is worth it !!

Reviews.Title: “Just magic”
Reviews.Author: elmtreeSydney
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 3 nights with wonderful service provided. Room modern and comfortable,excellent bed. The location is brilliant, a short walk to wonderful attactions and the Metro. Breakfast was delightul in a gorgeous setting. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Parisian”
Reviews.Author: EdOcean
Reviews.Content: The Keppler was perfectly appointed. Nestled off a little street, it offered every amenity and was most comfortable, especially the bed. Stay once and you'll stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Tucked away Paris gem”
Reviews.Author: cparadelo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over 8 nights for my first time in Paris. Concierge team is fantastic, making solid recommendations for unforgettable meals throughout the city. Room was adorably small and well-appointed, as was the bathroom. We had a street facing room with great light. Breakfast is very generous and well-serviced. I did not try the spa services but it is great to have the option! Keppler is a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Very chic”
Reviews.Author: Balletfans
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in the Keppler, and were in the Penthouse Suite, which was a real luxury. It is small but chic. The view of the Eiffel Tower was stunning from the 2nd bedroom, and I sat on my bed watching it sparkling! There is a small sitting room with a great sofa, 2 bedrooms and the master bedroom has a rain shower room and great design, and the 2nd bedroom has a bath with a shower attached. The location is superb, literally 5 mins from the Champs Elysees and George V metro. Even though it is so close, you can't hear the traffic. The breakfast is fantastic with everything you could possibly want and literally keeps you going all day. All the staff were friendly, and the broken coffee machine in our room was replaced with a huge flask of coffee which kept up going all evening. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Terrible Staff”
Reviews.Author: GingeAccountant
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. Yet the staff we found quite rude. I bought the trip to Paris for my girlfriend to attend a cooking class in france, a dream of hers as an xmas present. To cut a long story short we missed the cooking class. We arrived in Paris at 12pm and when we arrived at the hotel the time was 2pm, which, with the one hour time difference the time seemed reasonable. The alarm was set and it turned out the time in our room was an hour fast and that we had subsequently missed our class, at my expense.
