Later that afternoon I complained to the concierge, as I didn't expect this from a expensive hotel and I had wasted my money and the trip. He said he would email management. We heard nothing. The next day upon leaving, I asked the other concierge (Cedric) for an email address for me to be able to follow up my complaint. Cedric referred to me as 'the alarm clock guy' and said it was not his problem, the whole time looking down his nose at me. He stated that I should have checked the time ( however I didn't turn my phone on due to roaming charges and because I didn't want to be disturbed by the office) and that he has checked with his manager and the response was that ' we are not liable ' I should have perhaps double checked the time - but the response of the hotel was discraceful, making me look idiotic and not welcome. Never again Keppler.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Boutique Hotel in Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Picky1234
Reviews.Content: I am a very fussy traveler and was so excited to see that this Hotel fit the bill for everything I love about smaller hotels. The staff was AMAZING.. everyone could not have been more helpful and accomodating.. beginning with the emals online for reservations. We stayed 7 nights all together in an executive room that was quiet and well decorated. The traditional rooms did look small, but again quite well decorated and cozy and modern for for Europe I believe. The main rooms were absolutely beautiful. Just the right size and so comforting to return to after a day of sightseeing or after dinner. Once i figure out how to post pictures I will show you..

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little design hotel in a heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Ondina_2011
Reviews.Content: We spend a perfect long weekend in Paris. Our choice to stay was "Keppler" - a perfect small design hotel in a heart of Paris. Our compliments goes to overall experience with this hotel - rooms and hotel interior are designed with great taste and sense for balance, staff was very polite, helpful and friendly, and the location is perfect - near Arc de Triumph and 3 metro stations... Our definite choice if we come back to Paris. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Perfect Location and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Arcadia_Traveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite a find. The staff knew the city, and made good suggestions where to eat. They were very courteous and accommodating. The room was clean, and well kept. The entire experience was positive. The room was dead quiet, and we were even on the street side. Not sure how they soundproof, but it works! A+

Reviews.Title: “An incredible Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WJFellows
Reviews.Content: This is my first review, I was compelled to write this review due to my stay here at the Hotel Keppler. I am writing this review as we prepare to check out, our stay here has been exceptional, the rooms are spacious, beautiful, and equipped with all you could possibly need. The real beauty of this hotel though is the service, in an age where we have all come to expect mediocre service, the Hotel Keppler has decided to go a different direction. From the moment we arrived everyone was great, the first night when we decided to have a bottle of wine in the little fireplace area of the bar they not only brought us the wine, but Simon the bartender also brough us sausage, cheese, crackers, these great little pickles, etc... All of the food was provided to us free, it maid a perfect little meal. On our last night my wife was not feeling well and wanted to stay in, she wanted pizza which wasn't on the room service menu, one call to the front desk and they sent someone out to a local pizza place and brought us back one of he best pizzas we have ever had. I could go on and on here, this was just a fantastic hotel, don't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded every expectation!”
Reviews.Author: ericabuchanan
Reviews.Content: I just returned from our 4 night stay at the Hotel Keppler. My husband and I went with another couple, great friends, to celebrate my 40th bday. We arrived early in the morning, not expecting our room to be ready, but to drop our bags. Instead we were invited to enjoy breakfast in the beautiful breakfast room and when we were done our room would be ready. After breakfast they offered us an upgrade to the 2 BR penthouse suite instead of our 2 rooms! It was BEAUTIFUL and definitely set the tone for the rest of our incredible stay. The concierges, Cedric and Philipe, were both extremely helpful and friendly. The bartender Simon was wonderful too! We enjoyed talking to all of them while we relaxed in the beautiful lobby. The American-style breakfast buffet was excellent, and again service was exceptional. The location was fantastic during the day. We could easily walk to the Arc de Triomphe, EIffel Tower, Seine, Champs and even the Louvre. Metro was a short walk. In the evening it was very quiet though and we would have liked a little more nightlife closeby. But that would be absolutely my only reservation. Overall it was an absolutely fantastic trip, made all the more so because of the staff and accommodations at the Keppler! Merci, Merci!!!

Reviews.Title: “A little gold mine of a hotel near Champs Elysees”
Reviews.Author: Juchiban
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located three blocks away from champs élysées, a major shopping area and also to the metro. My wife and I stayed there for 7 nights. The hotel is superb in many ways starting with great concierge service, Cedrick, Vincent, and Phillip notably. Their recommendations were great mostly and they explained the traveling to each location and gave us a google print out of the direction after leaving the subway for each location. Along with helping us make dinner and show reservations, this was a great service. The concierge is located right to the side of the single entrance and exit available so you are always greeted in and out by the concierge. The porter, notably Shaymon, is quite polite and follows up with all requests. The hotel is very close knit. The breakfast is room service or buffet style, everything is fresh and selection is great considering it's a boutique hotel. Everything was very clean in the hotel and rooms including the towels, which had no stains what so ever. Little touches made the stay very nice including the watering of plants outside your room, chocolates accompanying a notecard of tomorrow's weather, and decorative folding of your bedsheets, complement of a power adapter. My only wish is if the classic room that we had was a bit bigger, but be sure all your amenities are there, creatively stored. Also the heating and cooling system is central. It's either all air conditioning or all heat in the hotel. Although, each room can independently turned the ac or heat on or off, you do not have the option of selecting ac or heat for your room, it's which ever the hotel chooses. But besides this, this hotel really have great service, the staff speaks English and there are a lot of little extra touches like an umbrella in the closet.

Reviews.Title: “A bit strange, I guess”
Reviews.Author: clays4sue
Reviews.Content: The hotel is spotlessly clean and appointed as pictured. It's location wasn't perfect for us, being several blocks from the Metro station George V. The room was 500EU a night with the larger size I thought we needed. However, it was still quite small. The bed was excellent. I guess I agree with another reviewer who said that he saw it more as a B&B than a hotel. I think for the expense, you can find something more convenient and larger.

Reviews.Title: “Petit Piece Of Paris”
Reviews.Author: chicchick707
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is a little gem, the decor is very tastefully done and appropriate for Paris. Little is the key word though when it came to the room size. The rooms are on the small size but are very comfortable at the same time The television reception was not the best and the wifi connection was a job since the code was constantly changing. The staff was outstanding and willing to assist with any and all requests. We especially enjoyed coming back to the hotel after a long day of touring, to sit in the cozy "living room", enjoy a beverage and snack offered by Simon- the most delightful bartender we have ever encountered. Breakfast and the staff in the Breakfast room were EXCELLENT!! Although we understand hotels in good locations in large cities like Paris are often expensive I do believe that perhaps the Keppler is still just a little overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: ALKY2002
Reviews.Content: The welcoming, friendliness, decoration, comfort, service, support of the front desk... All perfect, 100% satisfied. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the japanese approach in the heart of paris! Black & white story!”
Reviews.Author: kikola12
Reviews.Content: Beautifully decorated, the whole hotel & rooms, excellent location a step out of champes elysee! Want to be back there again! Highly reccomend it as well as awarded by the trip advisor! Keppler our love in paris 2011!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing stay- we loved the Keppler!”
Reviews.Author: laurenpk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at the Hotel Keppler for our Paris/London trip in early March 2011. We had a fabulous time, and experienced excellent service, a very nice, clean and well-decorated room, and a lot of little extra touches that we thoroughly enjoyed. We arrived at about 8am, and they amazingly had a room ready for us, which was critical since we were very sleep deprived, and were able to refresh before beginning our day out in Paris. The rooms and lobby/public spaces were sparkling clean. Some might think the rooms were small, but as we had booked the smallest (standard), I actually thought they were more than adequately sized, with a large bed and very nice bathroom. We had breakfast included in our package, and we were very impressed with this as well. They had a full range of meats/cheeses/bread, lots of different kinds of fresh fruit, at least 2 different hot dishes each day, and coffee/tea/cappuccinos and juices. They give you a card for a free glass of champaign or wine anytime during your stay, and we also were given some crackers/snacks to munch on from the nice bartender since it was in the evening and he guessed that we hadn't eaten dinner yet. Location: This is about a 5 min. walk from the George V metro stop. It is a bit of a distance from things like the Louvre/Musee d'Orsay/Notre Dame, but about a 10 min walk to the Arc de Triomphe, 12 min. walk to the Seine, a 20 min walk to the Eiffel tower, and again, not from at all from a Metro stop that will get to anywhere very quickly. Overall I would highly recommend the Keppler to anyone looking for a comfortable, clean, and highly pleasant place to stay in Paris. If we are able to return to the city, we will plan to return to this hotel for sure!

Reviews.Title: “WOW truly a French themed hotel!”
Reviews.Author: getmarshall
Reviews.Content: Booked the Keppler on exchange for frequent flyer miles and was very excited for my visit. I had a superior room and it was plenty spacious, tastefully and thoughtfully decorated. The bathroom was wonderful, plenty big and stocked with all the amenities even a tv in the mirror. Kind of odd, but it was nice. The bed was comfortable and I had a good nights rest. The room had two windows so plenty of light. Used the WIFI and that worked good. The breakfast was very nice and fully stocked. The personal bread basket and coffee was nice to have at the table. The lobby was very nicely decorated with a small bar and library there. The hotel is small and tucked onto a nice quiet street. Its a 5-10 min walk to the Champs Elysees and the Georges V metro stop. Overall, a wonderful hotel and I would absolutely return next time I return to Paris. This truly is what a french hotel should be small and intimate.

Reviews.Title: “lovely Bed & Breakfast but not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: kvg7
Reviews.Content: This review is based purely on the stay in a classic room and in no way reflects upon the lovely service of the employees there. As they say, there are no bad dishes in a good restaurant and there should be no bad rooms in a good hotel. The problem with Keppler is that the classic (and even the standard) rooms are so small that they should be considered unacceptable for a 4 star hotel. I know the popular excuse is "well, this is Paris" but the truth is that there are plenty of 4 star hotels in Paris with properly-sized rooms, even the most basic ones. Hotel Balzac for example or Hotel de la Tremoille are in the same area but would fit the standards of a 4 star hotel. Keppler's rooms are ridiculously small - in fact, if you open the closet door, it actially hits the bed so that you cannot get out until you close it. The other side of the bed which is near the window is so close in fact that you could not put your foot down at the edge of the bed without hitting your face against the window. The bathroom and shower are so tiny that you have to maneuver yourself to get in and out of them and the "romantic low" lighting in the bathroom is of no use to women who actually need the light to do their hair and makeup. Yes the breakfast is lovely and so are the people in the reception area who do their best to please - even though there is no actual concierge in the hotel. However, to refer to this property as a 4 star hotel (even a boutique one) is not fair to the actual 4 star hotels that have earned this merit.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: 10179k79
Reviews.Content: After trying out several hotels in Paris I always come back to the Keppler. Very tastefully decorated, clean and well maintained, good service, truly feels like a home away from home. Only caveat is the fact that the standard rooms are extremely small, with barely enough room to walk around the bed. Also, the location may be somewhat out of the way for some (but always worked for me).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel with some small areas of improvement”
Reviews.Author: Wildsnoopster
Reviews.Content: Hotel Keppler is a lovely boutique hotel near the Arc de Triomphe. This hotel has a lovely exterior and interior design and has staff that are extremely helpful. It is well equipped for almost all your needs including a fitness gym in the basement, bar, library in a quiet location. Breakfast is a small selection of cereals, pastries, juices, cold meats, cheeses, eggs plus a couple of hot dishes. All the food was fresh and very tasty however was set up for those staying for a short stay as there is no variation (except the two hot dishes) on a day to day basis. Rooms. We stayed in room 102 which overlooks Rue de Keppler. This is a smallish room with a kingsize bed, dressing table plus an en-suite with shower/bath etc. The decor is great and the only real criticism is that the owners have gone for style over substance as the skirting boards in the bathroom are starting to rot as the shower curtain is not big enough and therefore the water splashes over the side and the shower head is too heavy for the fitting and so anyone over 170 cm tall cannot stand underneath it. Staff. The staff are very helpful although their recommendations on food were questionable. They could not do enough for us and were helpful from the moment we arrived to the point they ordered the taxi back to the airport. Overall the hotel is located towards the Arc and therefore is not central but is in a quiet location within a 5 minute walk of the George V metro, a great little hotel in a lovely city which I am sure we will visit again. Wine Tasting at O Chateaux was excellent, boat trip on the Seine is worthwhile, trip up the Eiffel Tower is a must, the Louvre could take a full day to get around so make time. Places we ate Chez Francis (Avenue George V) - Average French, it is OK but would not go there again Casa Luca (Avenue Marceau)- Average to poor Italian would not recommend Angelina (Rue de Rivoli) - real hot chocolate but very rich, be warned even my chocoholic wife could not finish her hot chocolate and cake Oh Mon Cake (Rue Sant Honore) - Lovelly cake shop in 1st Arr with comfy sofas upstairs, good coffee and massive slices of cake Noura (Avenue Marceau) - lovely fresh shish kebabs that were very tasty Auberge dis Gourmets (Rue de 29 Julliet) - the cheapest meal we had and also one of the tastiest, would recommend and the proprietor was very helpful to feed up in a short period of time

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice but a Few Misses”
Reviews.Author: Artemus_Gordon
Reviews.Content: First the Plusses...Absolutely gorgeous inside, nice change from the stuffy tired look at many European hotels. Location is fairly convenient between Arc and Eiffel Tower on a quiet street one block from avenue Marceau. Metro a 3 block walk, close to Champs Elysee. Overall, service and helpfulness were very good, but a hiccup or two. Suggested an alternate to a restaurant I was going to visit that was an excellent choice (Jamin). High speed internet was free and very good. Breakfast buffet was excellent and service was exceptional. Shortcomings...was double billed (prepaid with Amex points, but charged anyway). I think resolved. The 4am desk personnel was probably not their A team. The rooms are small; we had upped to a standard from classic, but still very, very tight. Restaurant recommendation on a Sunday night was really too far away for late at night and wasn't that terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay when in Paris”
Reviews.Author: didiManchesterUK
Reviews.Content: We must spent 4 nights at the hotel Keppler, to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary. The hotel is simply wonderful - we had a beautiful executive room, luxury on a small scale. The decor is modern classic, chic and sumptuously comfortable. Staff couldn't be more helpful or courteous, the perfect mix of professional yet friendly, and the breakfasts were delicious, served in a delightful downstairs room by a smiling 'family' of staff. Room service was impeccable too. Location was great for us and very central for exploring Paris. Go and see for yourselves! Well deserved accolades hotel Keppler - merci pour tout!

Reviews.Title: “What a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: laurieclarke87
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Keppler was faultless. From the concierge service prior to arriving to the service at checkout we could not say a bad word about this hotel. The hotel itself is very well located, a stone's throw from the Champs Elysees and the Arc du Triomphe. Upon arrival we checked in and then were asked to wait for a bit as our room was prepared, to find when we were shown to our room that we had been upgraded to an executive room and a complimentary bottle of champagne was waiting for us on ice. The room was a good size and was beautifully finished to a very high standard and the bed was extremely comfortable. The staff, who spoke excellent English and put my French to shame, were extremely helpful and were able to book us a lovely, romantic restaurant on Valentine's day evening which is no mean feat! We had such a fantastic stay and I can't recommend this hotel enough!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: golfnut0618
Reviews.Content: Hotel Keppler is perfect in every way. Staff is great and very helpful. Spotless clean and modern amenities. Although small, you still get total privacy, even in the breakfast room, which has plenty of tables for 2. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, romantic, stylish boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: ladyninjitsu
Reviews.Content: I actually visited Hotel Keppler in April 2009 but just realized I never reviewed it, but because we had such a great experience I still want to share my long overdue review. We wanted to pick the perfect hotel because Paris was soon-to-be the city we got engaged. Needless to say we picked the right hotel. It's on a quiet block, not too far from the Champs Elysees and Arc de Triomphe. We were very happy with our room. It was done in shades of lavender, grey, black and white...the bathroom had toile wallpaper -- very chic, very Parisian! We knew it wasn't going to be an overly spacious room but it didn't bother us because we set our expectations ahead of time and thought it was comfortable and cozy. Also, the breakfast was really good. They had a nice spread of pastries and other delicious little French goodies. I would have to say - the part I remember the most was the hotel manager who helped my husband with making the restaurant recommendation for where he would eventually pop the question. Mind you, this guy knows nothing about us but the restaurant he picked was absolutely perfect. When we came back to the room that evening, he had left a bottle of chilled champagne and a congratulatory note. Superb! He also made other restaurant suggestions during the week, all of which were amazing. He even booked reservations for us which was super helpful. Who says the French are rude? At least he was not -- he made our stay in Paris unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Stylish Boutique Hotel. Highly Recommend.”
Reviews.Author: ChefsChoice
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel! The rooms are well-appointed, staff are friendly/helpful, and the location is convenient. My stay here was a pleasure from start to finish. I'd recommend this hotel without hesitation and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not your typical Paris service experience because it was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: JBPtraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night in January in a standard room, concierge sent us reccomendations for dinner & cocktails in advance via e mail, comfortable check in, great staff, great beds. Deserving of 5/5

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic hotel for either business or pleasure in Paris”
Reviews.Author: HeidiWD
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 9 nights in Hotel Keppler. Not only is it well-positioned next to the Champs Elysee and within walking distance from Metro and from many wonderful tourist sites, but the comfortable atmosphere and the WONDERFUL staff really make us want to return. I honestly cannot say enough about how well we were treated. They went out of their way each and every day to set up tours, make recommendations as well as reservations at restaurants. It is a small enough hotel that you quickly know all the staff and they know you personally. On the day of our arrival, they allowed us to check-in (tired from our flight) at 7 AM and did not charge us extra for this VERY early arrival. This is a perfect place to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “The Keppler Lives Up to All Reviews and Then Some”
Reviews.Author: TEPE
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on trip advisor reviews. I cannot say enough about this charming boutique hotel. The decor is beautiful, the rooms small but charming and best of all, the staff are more than helpful. This hotel will not disappoint. My daughter and I stayed at the Keppler in July for 4 nights (review a bit delayed). From the minute we pulled up at the door in our cab we were treated with warmth and kindness. We arrived at 8:00 a.m. and so our room was not ready yet. We were tired after flying overnight and were immediately offered a shower room to change and freshen up, along with robes, slippers etc. Even though check-in is not until the afternoon, we were told to check back in a couple of hours and they would do their best to have our room ready so my 12 year old could get some sleep. Our room was ready by 10:00 a.m. Our room was standard, but charming and comfortable. The bed and linens were good quality. The room was very clean. If you are looking for a view; there isn't one. The breakfast was lovely and the breakfast staff were very helpful and accommodating despite being extremely busy. The fresh squeezed orange juice and pastries were a hit with my daughter. More than anything I have to commend the staff. From Phillipe to Shyamon, they went beyond what I would have expected for service. Everyone we encountered at this hotel was professional and friendly. I want to make a special mention of Cedric, the concierge who really made the experience wonderful for my daughter. Each night she looked forward to going down to Cedric's desk and picking our evening restaurant with him and getting his tips for sightseeing. Cedric is a master of customer service. I would not hesitate to recommend the Keppler to anyone I know traveling to Paris, and would not hesitate staying there again. I found the best prices for this hotel through Otels.com and had hotelhotel.ca match it.

Reviews.Title: “A little jewel box”
Reviews.Author: Here_in_SF
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a top floor suite and had a peek-a-boo view the Eiffel Tower. The room was smaller than a normal suite but packed full of everything you have ever wanted, needed or wished for. The rooms were so lovely that my Interior designer mother wants to recreate it in a guest room at her own home. The service was wonderful and full of warmth - which is always an nice change in Paris. Breakfast was superb and the room they serve it in is equally fantastic! The coffee was excellent. And oh yes - the tiny gym was actually quite nice with top grade equipment. The true test of hotel s if you would go again - and I would in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfect!”
Reviews.Author: pdid777
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Paris to hook up with my adult daughter who was working there for a few weeks. We loved The Keppler! It was everyone we had hoped for in a Paris hotel. It was immaculate and exquisitely designed with sophisticated taste. The rooms were not large, but very chic - high quality and comfort! The huge breakfast was beautifully presented with a wide array of choices, including 'to order' omelets. Phillipe and Cedric, the concierges, were so helpful and knowledgeable. They took care of many arrangements via email before our arrival. Only problem was you often had to wait as they work one at a time. Loved the location - very private, but so close to the Metro and the Champs-Elysee which looks magical at Christmas time.

Reviews.Title: “Looks just like the pictures and is even better in person!”
Reviews.Author: pgood2
Reviews.Content: Couldn't say enough great about this hotel and the staff. We were so tired after sightseeing all day and it was a pleasure to come back to a lovely place and beautiful surrondings and a cozy bed. Quiet but in the heart of Paris. Easy to walk to Champs Elysees and the hop on hop off tours. Staff is so accomodating! Nothing ruffles their feathers! Need a last minute dinner reservation or miss your train and need to stay another night... no problem they swoop in and save the day! The Ritz Carlton has nothing on this hotel! Say hello to Shyamon for us the wonderful bellman/bartendar! This was our 1st trip to Europe and we had just come from London, UK and went on to Rome and into Italy but we still couldn't stop talking about the wonderful time we had at The Keppler and Paris altogether was a pleasant surprise and so warm and friendly!

Reviews.Title: “A dream come true!”
Reviews.Author: heodeza
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotel Keppler was magnificent, from the first second to the last. We loved our cosy room which was extremely well appointed and furnished. Every detail of the room and indeed the whole hotel is very well thought-out and it's a pleasure to be in such beautiful surroundings. The staff were delightful and very attentive. The sauna and steam room is a great addition to the hotel, and a wonderful way to relax the muscles after a busy day in town! Hotel Keppler is ideally located right next to the Champs Elysees and the Arc de Triomphe is just steps away. We had the best time there, and would highly recommend it to anyone, especially for a special, romantic time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best boutique hotels in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Hamburg_meine_Perle
Reviews.Content: - top service level - very nice and individually designed interior in modern-classic design (lobby, bar, rooms) - very well equipped rooms - quality continental breakfast - good locations in the fashion quarter of Paris, close to the Arc de Triomphe and River Seine - small rooms (typically for Paris)

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to Move In”
Reviews.Author: GayTravelGuyDC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Keppler since I could use frequent flier miles, and the reviews of Tripadvisor. I'm so glad I did; I loved the hotel. The staff were fantastic, the room small but very nice, the public spaces all elegant without being too fussy or antiquated. The hotel is on a very quiet street and allows an amazing night's sleep. I will return to this hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Really really lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scorchy
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the other rave reviews. On a 3 day business trip to Paris, I had the chance to be upgraded to the top floor suite with terrace and jacuzzi - the view of the eiffel tower was great, especially at night with the sparkly lights. TVs everywhere including in the mirror in the bathroom (yep) and very smartly decorated rooms with everything you could wish for including the bathrobes and swanky black slippers. Staff were delightful, and very helpful and I don't really have a bad word to say. Five star all round at 3 or 4 star prices. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Paid a pretty penny, but worth it”
Reviews.Author: Ange0511
Reviews.Content: We had the last 4 nights of our trip here and it was fantastic. I was dubious about the amount of money we paid but it was definately worth it. We stayed in a suite, which was roomy and loved the colours. The staff were very, very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was also yummy.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best boutique hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Ulysses-Magellan
Reviews.Content: I recently spent three days on my first visit to this haven of discreet luxury which is clearly one of the most appealing boutique hotels in Paris. The Keppler's central location is ideal; the décor and physical amenities are extremely attractive and what also helped to make the experience memorable was the warm and welcoming atmosphere created by Francois Gelly and his outstanding team. It was very much like staying with old friends in their beautiful town house.

Reviews.Title: “No reservation on arrival!”
Reviews.Author: Nichola72
Reviews.Content: I had booked (and pre-paid) three rooms via Expedia. On arrival we were told that the booking hadn't gone through to the hotel in time, and that by the it did they were fully booked. It would have been nice to have been told this prior to 8pm on the date of arrival. They said that they had found another hotel, but it only had two rooms...not helpful when it three were booked originally. I have made two calls to the hotel to get an explanation, and advised that the Reservations Manager will call me back...I'm still waiting.

Reviews.Title: “WOW WOW WOW! Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: burrowbk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights, the hotel has small rooms however they are beyond nice!! The staff was very nice and easy to work with, can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, Great location, Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ljohnst
Reviews.Content: We took a trip to Paris to celebrate my birthday and were thrilled with Hotel Keppler. The concierge, Philippe, was very friendly and courteous and assisted in recommending all entertainment and dining options. The recommendations were top notch! The hotel room was large and comfortable with fantastic amenities to include a private balcony overlooking the Eiffel Tower. The location was also perfect - just a couple of short blocks to the Champs Elysee. I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT HOTEL FOR PARIS”
Reviews.Author: MIKEL66
Reviews.Content: We just came back from 5 wonderful days in Paris at the Hotel Keppler. It was the perfect place to stay. First of all, the location is great, you can walk to the famous Champs-Elysees, Eiffel Tower, Arc De Tromphe, and others of the must see places in Paris , as well as the Metro Station. The Keppler is charming boutique hotel with impeccable service. My wife was thrilled with the marble and tile bathroom, lovely amenities and oversized towels. Included in our rate was a full breakfast, with many choices including made to order omelettes,.They even remembered what we liked for breakfast and had it ready for us without asking. Our favorite thing at the hotel was the staff. Phillip E, the concierge , couldn't have been nicer. His advice was always perfect and we were smart enough to listen to it. He, and his staff recommended 5 places for dinner and each one was delicious. The entire staff was courteous and helpful. We hope to return someday to our jewel in Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “This place is a true gem in a great location at an excellent price.”
Reviews.Author: fgjarrett
Reviews.Content: For the second year running, we chose to spend our Paris vacation at Hotel Keppler with our extended family which included kids aged 2 and 9. This boutique hotel continues to provide top-notch service to guests, and Philippe and others went beyond the norm to help us out in every way possible. The location of the hotel could not be better; it is very close to the Champs D'Elysees, but the Eiffel Tower could be seen form the balcony in our daughter's room. In addition, it is in a quiet street so noise is never a problem. The price we paid for our room was too good to be true! We also want to rave about the fantastic breakfast buffet we had each day, which kept us going till dinner, and the choiceof items in the buffet pleased every member of our extended family from the 2 year old through the seniors. We cannot imagine going to Paris and staying anywhere else on any future visit.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: geoffbanks
Reviews.Content: The most striking thing about this hotel is the service. friendly and attentive. nice rooms and great location. if you like Paris want a nice hotel and don't want to pay a fortune I thoroughly recommend this one

Reviews.Title: “Don't hesitate to book this elegant, cozy hotel! We will return!”
Reviews.Author: jazzieaggie
Reviews.Content: We arrived early in the morning from the US and wanted to drop off our bags at the hotel. They not only held our bags, but lead us to the spa washroom where my husband and I had separate rooms to freshen up in. Then, they led us to the breakfast room and told us they would call when the room was ready. We had the most friendly and accommodating attendant, who not only showed us our room, but served as bartender and helped us with any little thing we could have wanted. The room was amazing! Everyone talks about Parisian hotels being tiny but this was adequately roomy and exceptionally decorated. The bathroom was large (although the European short glass shower door confuses me), spotless, and modern. The beds were large and comfortable and the armoire was big enough (with more than enough hangers) for both of us to unpack entirely). We can't say enough about this hotel - a few blocks to the metro, Champs Elysses, and George V. The service was superb and the feel was elegant, clean, and cozy. We will definitely stay here the next time we are in Paris. Thank you, Hotel Keppler, for making our trip perfect!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Paris . Close to...”
Reviews.Author: Gipsio
Reviews.Content: The best hotel in Paris . Close to everything ( metro about 2-5 min ) Very friendly people especialy for Americans . Highly recomended .Breakfast worth every penny .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Niro_CA
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located on a quiet street but walking distance to shopping, sightseeing, and metro stations. The staff are very courteous and make every effort to make your stay comfortable. Since this is a boutique hotel you don't have to stand in lines or in crowded lobby areas. We would definitely stay at this hotel when we're in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “"Best Boutique Hotel we've ever stayed in"”
Reviews.Author: dodie86
Reviews.Content: We chose the Fantastic Hotel Keppler based on information and reviews from Trip Advisor. We were greeted by a wonderful young gentleman called Winston in reception and our bags were taken by a helpful young bellboy. We had spoilt ourselves and gone for the Deluxe Suite with views of the Eiffel Tower. Our room wasnt ready because we arrived quite early in the morning so they offered us some breakfast and we relaxed in the beautiful observatory. We were then taken up to another room so we could freshen up and relax. After a few hours we were then taken to our suite and were amazed!! The room was spectacular! They looked after us so well, they could not do enough for us. The room service, the housekeeping, everything about this hotel was amazing!! The location was absoloutly fantastic as well, centrally located to all the main attractions. Thankyou Keppler for a wonderful hotel experience and making our ENGAGEMENT so very special!! I definately recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoeAnne57
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay there. Rooms small but that is Paris. Hotel very clean, nice location, funky decor.

Reviews.Title: “Charming but spend for larger room”
Reviews.Author: Norris59
Reviews.Content: We traveled with another couple. Luckily, we both used our skymiles to book rooms. Hotel is in a nice, but perhaps too quiet section of Paris midway between the Trocadero and Champs-Elyesse. Excellent staff, very richly appointed rooms with a good breakfast. The only negative is the size of the rooms. The rooms are very small, even by Europeon standards. We had the 'Executive" Room while our travelling companions had the Deluxe Room. Our room(Executive) was barely big enough for two, while the Deluxe Room was not big enough for the two people we were traveling with. The hotel rates in Paris are very, very expensive. If you can afford their larger room I would recommend this hotel. However, I cannot recommend their Deluxe or Standard room for two people. While the lobby and bar area are stylish and attractive, you would be better to stay at a lesser hotel with a bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fokai
Reviews.Content: Hotel Keppler is an eclectic boutique hotel about a 10 minute walk from Champs Elysees. The lobby is small, but beautiful with a tiny bar area. Truth be told, it has more of a lounge feel and is very cozy. The common areas are well decorated and very inviting. Our room was an "Executive" room. I booked that level of room because I didn't want to feel like we would be in a "shoebox" as is common in many European hotels. I was very pleased with the spaciousness of the room. Bright yellow and black adorned the bed and walls, and gave the room a funky, hip feel. The bathroom was on the small size, toilet, bidet, tub/shower, and tv in the mirror. My only gripe would be the shower. As with many European showers, the glass shower door covers only have of the tub. Aside from that, we had a great stay. Room was very comfortable, staff was very welcoming despite our very limited French. Hotel is in a cute area (yes I just said cute), close walk to Champs, restaurants, Metro. We had a great time and would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and a secret revealed...”
Reviews.Author: Kate2005
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic... Amazing staff and service: thank you Matthew, Cedric and Mr. De Silva - we we're very impressed. Nice location, an impressive breakfast and an excellent room. The hotel is well decorated and maintains a chic parisien atmosphere. We loved our room (101). Secret: The bed/mattress recalls me one of the best I ever stayed, The Bed (not a bed) in Palace Hotel, NY. I have a say that you can't forget an amazing night sleep and who ever stayed in Palace knows what i'm talking about... Keppler is almost perfection in this matter. Not a negative fact or consideration to mention. I really recommend this hotel and would stay again if i ever go back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, but a Couple of Caveats”
Reviews.Author: fishskis
Reviews.Content: This is a beautifully designed hotel with a high end feel. Very luxurious, yet modern decor, with the new facilities in excellent condition. Additionally, the service is excellent; I had a small problem which I did not like the way the staff handled, and the General Manager was sympathetic and gracious with his remedy of the situation. I have two caveats about this hotel: 1) The "Classic Room" is very small. Very. It might be ok for you, but it was not for me. And 2) This is totally subjective, but I do not like the location, even though it is an excellent location. I just do not like the Champs Elysees/ Arch de Triomphe 8th/16th area; give me St. Germain or the Marais any time over this area. Note that this is widely considered a great location, in one of Paris' most elite neighborhoods, just a street or two away from The Four Seasons George V, one or Paris' (and the world's) top hotels; it is just not my favorite part of the city. If you are looking for a fairly priced beautifully designed upscale hotel with excellent service in the Champs Elysees area, you cannot go wrong here. note: I love great air conditioning, and this hotel has it!

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: mmth308
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Keppler during a 10 day trip to France in August. The hotel is a small boutique hotel, with very nice but small rooms. We enjoyed our stay a great deal. The staff was friendly, but not quite as outstanding as others have said. But we did not really go out of our way to interact, we did find much more outgoing and accommodating staff in our other hotels in France. The rooms are very nicely decorated, and very clean. The rooms are small, we had a standard queen room. The bathrooms are also quite small. These were the smallest rooms of our entire trip. The location of this hotel is also very convenient. Only caution I would have is the street is somewhat dark and abandoned at night, so some people might find that an issue. We did not. It is very close to the Arch de Triumph and the metro. I would recommend this hotel to others, and we stay here again when in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect experience”
Reviews.Author: Rutim
Reviews.Content: Had a great three night break here. Booked on late roomsznd got a good deal on an exec room. Hotel is a gem but the thing that makes this place is the service. Thanks to cedric and front of house for wonderful suggestions and the charming porters and domestic staff. Everyone here does their job with professionalism and good grace. They really care about their guests. Don't hesitate to book.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, relaxed and discrete.”
Reviews.Author: Sportyneil
Reviews.Content: A very elegant, relaxed and discrete hotel with the highest levels of service. Tastefully decorated in a gentle art deco style, our room was compact but very comfortable and quiet. A 5 minute walk from the Arc de Triumph end of the Champs Elysee and convenient for sightseeing. Superb breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “A Touch of Class with a Wow!”
Reviews.Author: chooseytraveler26
Reviews.Content: We had one night in Paris, and we hoped for a trendy, well located hotel with comfort. We found it in the Keppler. The lobbies and decor of the corridors and lifts were high quality style. The rooms were amazing! Comfortable, with all the amenities anyone could ever expect. TV's in every room, including the bathroom (in the mirror), and a cute terrace where we could have our morning coffee. We were 3 small streets from the Arc de Triomphe, and one street off Avenue Marceau. How much more central could one get. Only a 20 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. Staff was very helpful and friendly, and very courteous. We enjoyed it tremendously.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, helpful staff, wonderful ambience - what more do you need?!”
Reviews.Author: holidaysx
Reviews.Content: After a lot of research into Paris hotels we settled on the Keppler - a great choice! We had a wonderful stay - the staff were very friendly, polite and helpful, the suite was lovely with a super balcony and a great view of the eiffel tower. I thought the location was perfect - near enough to everything but still relaxing and quiet. We found it a great base to explore Paris. Only thing missing for us was possibly tea making facilities in the room and soya milk available at breakfast - otherwise perfect!! We will definitely return one day!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff, wonderful decor, great boutique hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: maf815
Reviews.Content: We absolutely LOVED the Keppler!! After hearing the sterotype about Parisians, we weren't sure what we would think of the staff. However, the staff was AMAZING!!! Probably close to the best staff we have ever encountered in a hotel. We were greeted by Matthew who was warm, kind and so HELPFUL! He mapped out our 4 days in Paris from start to finish. All of his recommendations were wonderful. We also met Cedric who was incredible as well. He even sent up complimentary drinks for my husband's birthday. We were so thrilled!!! The decor at Keppler is delighful. It is done so well. The room was small but so cute nonetheless. The breakfast was perfect! We loved the crepes and pancakes. The coffee was superb as well. The location is pretty good. It is still a 15 minute walk from the Metro. However, you are super close to the Arch de Triumph right next to the Champs Elysees. We highly recommend this hotel. The service is amazing. It is a perfect Parisan gem!!!

Reviews.Title: “Service the way we want it”
Reviews.Author: JerooPavri
Reviews.Content: If you are a family like we are (with 2 young children) the suite on the top floor was perfect. With a cute balcony with views of the Eiffel Tower this hotel hits the spot as far as price goes. It was cheaper for us to have the suite for our family than to pay for two interconnecting rooms which is vertually impossible to guarantee by Paris Hotels upon booking ! Great staff who are both efficient and friendly... even with children !

Reviews.Title: “Absolute suberb Parisien experience”
Reviews.Author: gtatraveller01
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in an excellent location and was beautifully decorated. We had drinks in the hotel bar and the service was probably the best we have ever experienced. We particularly enjoyed the attention from Shyaman who treated us so well. My mother did not go out for dinner and he offered after his shift to pick her up a sandwich which he then personally delivered to her room. Wow! It was a thoroughly enjoyable visit. Also, the breakfast servers were excellent. While the rooms are small by North American standards, the space was well utilized. I am extremely picky and I would rave about this hotel to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Sheets have hair on them from previous guests”
Reviews.Author: piphimon
Reviews.Content: Though the boutique hotel is very charming and has a great location, it needs much better housekeeping. My bathroom had dust on the floors underneath the towel stand. The bathtub and sink BOTH had problems draining. Lastly, and most disgusting, the coverlet (in between the two white sheets) had LOTS of hair from other guests and had obviously not been washed in a while. I requested a different coverlet and had someone deliver a new one, which had even MORE hair on it. For 500 dollars a night, I expect clean sheet. Spend your money elsewhere. The rooms were very small as well. My husband and I were on our honeymoon in Europe for 24 days so we had 3 pieces of luggage. We could barely fit it into the room.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Boutique Hotel in Top Location”
Reviews.Author: FlashSydney
Reviews.Content: In a quiet side street close to the Champs-Elysees - you could be a million miles rather than a few minutes walk from this busy boulevard. The staff really make this place even more enjoyable than the gorgeous decor. Nothing is too much trouble from the concierge to the porter and everything is done with a genuine smile. The breakfast is first rate. We had to leave for the airport at 7am and it was no trouble at all to organise a full - not a continental - breakfast at 6.45am. Our room was recently renovated and was very comfortable if a bit small. But it's the normal size for a boutique hotel in Paris. Around the corner is Le Malfil restaurant which is so much better than the restaurants on the Champs-Elysees itself. Intimate, welcoming and first rate food.

Reviews.Title: “No Non-Smoking Rooms - Do not believe their website!”
Reviews.Author: Away2much
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for two nights during a recent business trip. It's a lovely hotel as long as you don't mind smoking. I'm very serious about this statement. My colleague has asthma and after one night had to depart to another hotel. Every room has an ashtray which if they remember they remove before you check-in. They have a central AC system which pipes smoke into your room. I am allergic to cigarette smoke so I kept the AC off and my window open. The rooms are quite tiny - a bit smaller than other Paris boutique hotels I've stayed in but they are nice rooms. So if you don't mind smoke then this hotel is nice and in a good location. If smoke bothers you in any way do not stay here. Had my trip been any longer than two days I certainly would have gone to a different hotel. What bothers me the most is the dishonesty of the hotel in saying they have non-smoking rooms when clearly they don't. They also do not have a restaurant but serve breakfast in the morning. They can get you room service from around the area but your room is so small it would be better to leave the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved this chic boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: donnainnapoli
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Keppler is by far the best hotel I've stayed in in Paris. The location is ideal, as it is centrally located, but on a quiet side street. A walk to the Champs Elysees took a mere 10 minutes. The beds were extremely comfortable (a difficult thing to find in Europe!), and I fell in love with the super stylish rooms! Service was top notch. I will definitely return and be sure to recommend this hotel to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very chic!”
Reviews.Author: SuelindaLondon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights during a recent trip to Paris to see the French Tennis Open and the experience was very good. The location is perfect for those who want to shop at the luxury stores as they are all within walking distance of the hotel and the back streets are quiet and safe to walk through. We stayed in the traditional suite which was a fairly decent size, decorated in a townhouse style and well equipped including 3 TVs. We didn't have the breakfast preferring to go out and eat and they did try to charge us for it when we got the bill but once we informed them of this, they removed it quickly. Overall a pleasant hotel and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JenniferLynn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed three days at the Hotel Keppler last week while in Paris, and I would recommend it to anyone who wants a boutique hotel a little off the main-stream road. Location-wise, I thought the hotel was situated on a very quiet street a few blocks from the Arc de Triomphe and a couple of blocks from the nearest train stop. I do wish the hotel was two or three blocks closer to the train, but for three days in Paris, it was fine. As I mentioned, the hotel is on a very small street with no stores for at least a block or two. While that is very nice from a noise standpoint, keep that in mind if you’re going to be out late and coming back to a hotel on a dark street. We originally booked this hotel as part of an expedia package and I selected a Standard Room at the hotel which was supposed to come with a King Bed. Unfortunately, all Superior Rooms only have Queen beds (or as the hotel told me when I checked in, it’s a ‘European King’). I’m not sure who is to blame for that one, but it really didn’t make much of a difference as the queen bed was fine. I thought the size of the room was quite sufficient and I didn’t feel that it was that small. The bathroom was also of a nice size with decent countertop space. We did however have a complaint about our shower. Similar to the hotel we stayed at in London (so maybe this is a European thing), there really wasn’t any shower door that closed the whole area, so water went everywhere. After each of our showers, the floors and walls couldn’t help but be wet. Another minor grievance was while they provided shampoo, lotion and body wash gel, they didn’t give us any hair conditioner. At the same time, there were no face towels provided in the rooms. One grievance I had with the hotel was the very late cleaning of our rooms each day. We flipped the door sign to indicate we wanted our room cleaned by 9 am each morning, but one day our room wasn’t cleaned until 2 pm and then next day wasn’t until 4:30 pm. It was a little annoying in that we would come back to the room in the mid-afternoon wanting to relax just a bit before we headed out for more sightseeing and we really couldn’t be in the room to relax. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel, so we can’t comment on that aspect, but we did use the business center, and I use the term ‘business center’ very loosely. There was one terminal (with a printer) that you can use for 30 minutes at 5 Euro. For such a small hotel, I would have hoped that the usage of the computer would have been free. The lobby/foyer was nice, yet small with a lot of knick knacks everywhere. There wasn’t an inch of coffee table space or on the wall that wasn’t taken up by a painting or sculpture. As I mentioned before, I would recommend the hotel to others as I felt the room size was good and I thought the front desk was very nice and welcoming (and also spoke English!). I thought the hotel was in a good location and allowed us to catch the 1 Metro to all the main sights.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and intimate”
Reviews.Author: TravellingTrotters
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for a romantic trip in Paris as it is very luxurious and classy. It offers that extra special something as it had a very personal feel to it and the attention to detail was remarkable - I found it faultless. The buffet breakfast offered was of good quality so big thumbs up. The hotel is excellently positioned as it is very close to the Champ Elysees and Arc de Triomphe and just a short walk to the Eiffel Tower, yet is housed on a very quiet small street offering a bit of tranqulity. A very big thank you to the hotel staff ensuring a more than pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great quiet boutique hotel in good location with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: luvnlive2travel
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here for a week and a half - our first trip to Paris. We had a wonderful time thanks in part to the superb staff at the Hotel Keppler - they were kind and courteous, helped us with recommendations on restaurants, shows, things to see and easy modes of transportation. They were always available to help in any way at any time, and followed up to make sure everything was satisfactory (above and beyond in all cases). The hotel itself is charming with beautiful common areas, rooms are small but not too small, and very well appointed - very quiet, which I was suprised at being so close to the action. Breakfast is great each morning with a variety of hot and cold items to choose from and a friendly staff. Would definitely recommend this hotel if you're coming to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Most wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: dred1
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed for more than a week. The staff was truly wonderful in every way. Breakfasts were enough to keep you going for a good part of the day. Wonderful location for walking to the Metra, good restaurants and the Arc of Triumph. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelCt
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Keppler for 6 nts in May. From the moment we walked in we felt at home. The staff was so helpful and friendly. Cedric did a great job getting us reservations at all the restaurants we had hoped to dine at. The rooms are small but beautifully decorated and immaculate. The breakfast buffet was great quality and the dining area lovely. Couldn't have asked for a better place to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and warm luxurious boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Walker015
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my mother and two sisters in the penthouse suite of Hotel Keppler from 30 April to 3 May. From the very first enquiry until the moment we left after our stay, I have been impressed by the helpfulness and friendliness of all the hotel staff. No question was too complicated and we were assisted in our choice of restaurants as well as our program in Paris. Excellent service. The rooms were very clean and stylish, roomservice prompt and the breakfast fantastic. Very will located, close to Champs Elysees and Eiffeltower, I can thoroughly recommend this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small boutique & above average”
Reviews.Author: mkw61
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights with a number of friends on a leisure come business trip Nice room for a couple of nights but the rooms are very small. I asked to get shifted at my expense to a larger room as we wished to extend our stay another 4 nights & could not unpack our bags. Did not even get a reply from the not very interested night manager, All of the other staff where very pleasant & breakfast was great the location is very good & in a quiet street Thought when you book 4 rooms at these prices the staff would be keen to keep you as it turned out we discovered another SLH which was better value & much larger rooms. However i would still recommend for short stay as it is beautiful decorated & positioned.

Reviews.Title: “A stylish hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: LondonTraveller66
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Keppler for a few days at the beginning of April 2010. The hotel is in a good location on a quiet street and our room although small was stylish. The staff were extremely friendly, pleasant and helpful and we really enjoyed our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at the Keppler - we would definitely come again.”
Reviews.Author: KL-XVIII
Reviews.Content: We had a great 4 night stay at the Keppler. It was one of the quietest hotels we have ever stayed at - tucked away in a side street there was no street noise and there was no noise from other rooms or guests. All of the hotel staff/concierge were extremely helpful and friendly. They were very helpful in making all kinds of arrangements form tourist activities and transportation. The hotel is very nicely appointed and luxurious. The breakfast that was included in the package we selected was very good and satisfied the hard to please and discriminating palate of our 10 year old. The location is at one end of the Champs-Élysées, so it is not the most centrally located, but the George V Metro stop is reasonably close and it's not too far a walk to the Pont de l'Alma to catch a train. There is good reason why this hotel gets a high Trip Advisor rating.

Reviews.Title: “A thoroughly enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: shrek69
Reviews.Content: We opted to stay at Hotel Keppler having read reviews on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. The hotel itself is of classic Parisienne character and located in a quiet street just minutes from the Arc de Triomphe. Its location also benefits from the Paris transport system, with easy access to the metro, local buses and airport coaches etc. The staff were attentive but unobtrusive and in fairness the reception staff couldn't have done enough for a number of guests whom required their services. The Keppler is tastefully decorated, stylish and elegant. Our room 104 was a standard room but of reasonable size and overlooked the street. The breakfasts were fabulous with everything you could think of available and situated in a delightful room on the hotel's lower level. The other plus point being breakfast was available from 0700hrs to 1100hrs. On the same floor level a steam room and sauna are available though we didn't find the time to utilise these facilities. Bar staff were very friendly and helpful, Keppler also offers room service, which is supplied from a local bistro. There are plenty of cafes, bistros and restaurants in the vicinity of the hotel, and plenty more should you head towards the Champs Elysees. Avoid the Al Ajami Lebanese restaurant, my review of this restaurant is posted on TA. Whilst searching around the streets we stumbled upon an absolute gem of a restaurant called 6 New York. Located on Avenue de New York, it sits on the banks of the Seine and looks out onto the Eiffel Tower, great view when its illuminated and the searchlight pierces the night sky. The Chef/Owner pays you a visit at your table and informs you of the day's specials and takes your order, great personal touch. The food is just perfection, expect to pay in the region of 150 Euros for 2 persons including wine. May sound like a lot but when you consider the prices in Paris, then you truly do " Only get what you pay for"! Visit the website www.6newyork.fr. I wouldn't hesitate in recommending Hotel Keppler and should I return to Paris, this is the place I'll be returning to.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Awful Front of House Service”
Reviews.Author: paulhothi
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hotel Keppler to celebrate my 10 year wedding anniversary. I have been to Paris a number of times and was looking forward to a great trip. The reviews of Hotel Keppler on this site were very positive. The positives for the hotel are its location, the polite cleaning staff and also the very helpful barman (a Sri Lankan chap I think). I have travelled a lot in Europe and elswhere and have never thought to complain about any of my experiences over the last 15 years of travelling. The front of house at Hotel Keppler on the otherhand were unfriendly and given the fact that they knew we were celebrating a special occasion was surprising. At no point did we feel valued customers and the recommendations for restaurants were poor. The rooms are also small and not good value given the price of the same. We had no air conditioning and because the rooms were warm we did not sleep very well for 4 of the 5 nights. Given both myself and my wife lead busy working lives in an international law firm this added further dismay to our trip. There was no pro activity in dealing with this issue. Perhaps it is just a basic understanding of a clients' needs which is lacking. We will be making a similar comment to Mr and Mrs Smith with whom we booked the hotel. In summary, an arrogant front of house service spoilt a well organised trip. We would not recommend Hotel Keppler.

Reviews.Title: “Charming boutique hotel with very high standards of service..”
Reviews.Author: GordonandMairi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for a few nights for my 40th birthday. I had never been to Paris before and we wanted to be centrally located so we could enjoy easy access to all the obvious attractions. We loved the hotel and I would describe our room (standard room) as modest in size but very tastefully decorated. Throughout the hotel it is clear they have used a talented interior designer and the hotel manages to achieve a relaxed atmosphere, partly helped by staff who are keen to please but never intrude on your privacy. I would recommend the breakfast option as we found the quality of food and the service excellent. Also worth mentioning is the fabulous location. The hotel is a 5 min walk away from the Champs Elysees and there a vast choice of attractions and some fine restaurants. Strongly recommend this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: lineavega
Reviews.Content: Everything about our stay at the Keppler was perfect! The location is convenient to Arc D'Triomph and Champs Ellyses as well as train stations that will take you all over the city. The rooms are small but beautifully decorated and comfortable. There is a small fitness center with sauna, as well as breakfast room and business conference rooms. The real benefit of staying here is the service. Everyone we encountered was so nice and helpful. We received great recommendations for meals and help with reservations. We had booked a rate that included breakfast and it was well worth it. (There was a nice assortment.)Thanks to the Keppler for a wonderful stay in Paris! :) We would definitely stay again the next time we are in town.

Reviews.Title: “Really helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: vinoperson
Reviews.Content: The staff at the desk of this hotel was so helpful, particularly Mathew. All requests were handled well. This is the strongest asset of the hotel. This is a tough call because on the surface it is a truly nice hotel. Beautifully decorated, an absolute joy to walk into the lobby. The room I originally booked was tiny even by French-Paris standards. I took one look and knew I had to upgrade and did, the upgrade was a reasonable 30 euros per night. A long and pleasant discussion with the manager erased the 22 euro per night internet fee but why did I have to have that discussion when every park and cafe in Paris has free WIFI? After this discussion we were send a half botte of champagne, a lovely gesture. Breakfast was great, service and quality at good standard. We enjoyed our stay after we straightened out the kinks and upgraded, but at this price-point I feel there should not be any issues to deal with.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hôtel”
Reviews.Author: trevanon21
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to paris for our 30th Wedding Anniversary. Hotel staff spoke good English and offered an excellent service and good advice. We stayed in an executive room which was decorated to a high standard and had breakfast twice (continental) - once lower ground floor and once in our room. Pricey but good! Our stay was thoroughly enjoyable and we cant praise the staff highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Travelingtaff
Reviews.Content: Staff were execelent very helpfull. Food was superb. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ParrottheadHouston
Reviews.Content: A great, small hotel in an excellent neighborhood location. Near walking distrance to many sites or only several blocks to the Metro. VERY friendly and helpful staff who spoke good English, if needed. Provided excellent recommendations for nearby restaurants - bistros that were reasonably priced. Go to Oscar's!! It was all good here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: eastwestSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: Beautifully furnished boutique hotel. Unobtrusive, yet skilled, staff. We overlooked the small rooms. Excellent beds and bedding. The common areas: lounges, breakfast room are quiet havens. Cheers to the staff in both, and to the "front desk" team. Two long blocks to walk to the the metro, a bit uphill on the way back. But Paris is a walking city and the exercise all day compensates for all those meals!

Reviews.Title: “a marvellous stay ! in a magnificent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sofia_gThessaloniki
Reviews.Content: we had a 5 days stay at the hotel and it was the perfect experience! it is close to everything,so cozy,so upper level,the decoration unbelievable,very clean rooms,the staff gentle. The breakfast had a french taste,we loved it !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel with great, personal service”
Reviews.Author: BurgerB0y
Reviews.Content: I can't reccomend this place more highly. A stone's throw from the Champs Elysee and the Arc de Triomphe, we had a brilliant night in this charming hotel. We booked a superior suite with a view accross the rooftops to the Eiffel tower. The room was compact but well laid out with separate bedroom and lounge area, a wardrobe area and great bathroom with power shower and a TV in the mirror above the sink. We were sent a complimentary half bottle of champagne and nibbles by the hotel which was a lovely touch and when we got in from a night out, there was a chocolate Eiffel Tower waiting for us on the coffee table! The room was stylish, clean and comfortable and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. The only negative was various welcome notes etc referring to us as 'Mr and Mrs' - we're not married and it felt a little old fashioned,but that is a minor gripe. If you're looking for a stylish base in the city for a romantic break then this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful...lovely attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: MichaelShef
Reviews.Content: This was the first time in the Keppler hotel and we had booked an executive room. Very tired after an early journey via Eurostar but the hotel staff let us check in way before the normal time. They also offered us an upgrade into a beautiful suite which was just gorgeous! Lovely attention to detail throughout the hotel and a memorable stay - just wish we could have stayed longer than 2 nights. Very helpful staff. The location is not the most interesting but fairly quiet and central. Would love to come again, so better save up for one of the suites!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel...perfect location in a wonderful City”
Reviews.Author: Summer017
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Keppler for a weekend, we chose this hotel mainly from glowing reports on trip advisor..and we were not disappointed. This hotel is fabulous...the loaction is great, walking distance to most of the main attractions. Its very clean, very modern and cosy...yes the rooms are small but when your on a city break you spend most of the time out and about so it didnt really matter at all to us. The staff are freindly and recommended restaurants on both nights, Il Gusto Sardo was the best and not a tourist in sight just local people which was great. I would 100% recommend this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Best service I have ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: appley
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel having read TA reviews. From the moment we entered the hotel we experienced the highest standards of customer service from every one of the staff. We were given a great room, spacious, separate lounge area and a fully equipped bathroom. The front desk answered all our questions about what to do and where to go in Paris. One particular high point was the excellent breakfast. Often you get just the coffe and croissant offering but not here. Cereals, fruit, cold meats and cheeses, scrambled eggs, sausages and all kinds of breads and danish pastries were on offer on the buffet. This is not a cheap hotel, but then again where are there any cheap quality hotels in Paris. It s a 5 minute walk from George V metro station on Champs and if you are thinking about a special holiday in Paris you could do not better than give this hotel a try. It deserves its rating as one of the top 10 in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, don't think twice about booking.”
Reviews.Author: stushy
Reviews.Content: This really is a little gem of a hotel. Everything is perfect, from the lovely welcome to every detail in the hotle. The staff, every one of them, go out of their way to ensure you have a good time, they are always on hand to recommend a restaurant (all of which were perfect and within walking distance), poor a glass of wine, or in hubby's case a whisky, ask about your day and even give a weather report for the next day with turn down - oh yes and umbrella's are provided if it looks like rain. Breakfast is a joy, with every taste catered for - and all yummy. Rooms are perfectly furnished, ours was small but it didn't matter and there is no tea and coffee in the rooms either, and again it didn't matter - both those things usually would, but the hotel is so great, you don't even really notice. Location is great as well, very close to George V metro and great for walking places..........I can't sing the praises of this hotel enough, just go and see for yourself, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing is too much trouble for the staff at this fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: PeterandNina09
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed at this fabulous hotel for two nights during xmas week. We had great difficulty travelling to and from Paris due to the Eurostar and the staff were exceptional with regard to facillitating the booking of alternative travel and times of arrival/departure. I proposed to my partner at a restaurant reccomended by Philippe the Concierge Clefs D'or, who sent a special note to the restaurant to ensure I got the best service possible. This personal touch is invaluable in terms of making the stay special. If that wasnt enough the Hotel was 10/10, a small fashionable boutique located a 2 min walk from the Champs Elyses and 2 min taxi from the Eiffel Tower. Every room in this Hotel had style and a modern classic twist. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.......

Reviews.Title: “Wonder stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Joolsforester
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped into the lobby of this cute stylish hotel, we felt welcomed. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Everyone spoke English and went over and beyond to help us with our needs. Our room was on the 4th floor. Very clean and cute. Every night we received delicious chocolates on our bed and the staff even sent us a bottle of Champaign. ( What a surprise!) The breakfasts were delicious. The coffee was fantastic along with the fresh breads. The location was only a few minutes to the metro and good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: capriboy
Reviews.Content: I have found the Keppler on tripadvisor and I must say it is definitely a winner. It is a small luxury property where there is a great attention to details (and luxury is definitely in the details). The hotel is stylish, comfortable and in a great location. All the staff (Annabelle Le Coq just to mention one) is very nice, corteous and efficient. The cleaning ladies are simply amazing and I do not think I have ever seen a cleaner hotel. The breakfast is rich, fresh and tasty. You cannot go wrong with this choice.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and chic--a true boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: schnauzernyc
Reviews.Content: I have never been overly impressed with hotels in europe--small rooms are a given, but usually the decor, service and amenities are lacking as well. that's why i was so impressed and pleased with my stay at hotel keppler. it's designed to feel like a home--the "living room" areas are beautiful and comfortable and i surely did not mind unwinding after ridiculously long walks in paris with a glass of wine on the comfy sofas. the staff is super attentive (shyman, the bell-hop, bartender, room service delivery man, etc.) was particularly helpful. the rooms are small, but certainly no smaller than any other european hotel. the difference though is in the totally chic decor, luxurious bath complete with robe and slippers, and amazingly comfy beds. breakfast was also far superior to the ubiquitous hard boiled eggs/yogurt/sliced deli meats & cheeses you normally get. here it was a basket of fresh breads/pastries, pancakes or crepes, breakfast meats, fresh fruit, etc. needless to say i loaded up before heading out for the exhaustive days. overall, i'd definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: Joe_Munster
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went for her birthday. Quick 3 day, 3 night trip. The location of the hotel was fantastic, 2 blocks from the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysee, 20 minute walk to the Eiffel tower and La Trocadaro. Either Metro station on Champs Elysee was about a 5 minute walk and closer to several bus stops. The hotel was in my mind the definition of what a boutique hotel should feel like. The staff was very friendly while we were there as well as helping us with restaurant reservations and questions via email before we arrived. Here are my Pro's and Con's: 1. Great Location - close to attractions, etc. 2. Friendly Staff 3. Great Breakfast (Included) 4. Comfortable Beds 5. Very Clean 6. Very Boutique 7. Very Quiet: We were in room 305 which faced the courtyard. With the shades closed we accidentally slept until noon one day. 8. Located in a good, quiet neighborhood on a quiet street. Con's (This was not a problem for us) 1. No restaurant in the hotel. You can get room service from their sister hotel. Their are plenty of other places close by. The breakfast from 7 a.m. to 11 a.m. should fill you up until dinner. 2. The rooms are small. We were only in our room to sleep. It was very comfortable and fine for that purpose. 3. Drink in the lobby are expensive, but this is true everywhere in Paris. We were able to book this as part of an American Airline package and the value for us was very good. I would stay here again and highly recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunshine11650
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a stay in Paris where we stayed in this hotel for one night. We were due to stay in a standard room for two nights but there had been some over booking so we were asked if we would mind staying in another hotel of the same standard around the corner for one night and then return back to the hotel for the second night. In return they offered us an upgrade to a one bed suite (approx 700 euros per night room) and a bottle of champagne. We agreed to this. The room was fantastic with a small terrace and a view of the top of the Eiffel Tower. The room decor was beautiful and the space was great. The bottle of champagne turned out to be a bottle of Moet! The hotel was beautifully decorated and very modern but with a very comfortable feel. The lounge areasare true to the pictures and were nice to just sit and relax in and felt like you were in someones home and not a hotel. The barman/bellman was very good and very helpful. The fitness centre looked great, though we did not use this. the breakfast room was also great with a good choice of food. We would thouroughly recommend this hotel and would stay here again should we come back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “You won't be disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: granof3
Reviews.Content: the Hotel Keppler was a wonderful hotel for sightseeing. The area is safe and the concierge recommended several area restaurants that we enjoyed. The room was small but well appointed-quiet and comfortable. The staff really do try to make your stay a pleasant one. It is close to metro and the Champs Elysee which is great for taking in a great French experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very Paris, very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Bugyo
Reviews.Content: Modern and stylish with excellent service. I can't say enough about the service, perhaps the best I've ever had in a hotel. I have very high standards for service and Keppler really impressed. Room was well decorated, clean and comfortable. Hotel was well located. Very nice. I don't have any real complaints about the hotel, although the size of my executive room was a little smaller than I had expected. Not sure if they tried to rip me off with a mysterious pay tv charge at the end, but this was quickly fixed once I pointed it out. In any case, I will probably return next time I'm in Paris.
