Reviews.Title: “Like coming home”
Reviews.Author: Dogsey
Reviews.Content: I give this Hotel a five star rating because of the great service from all the staff, location and the room was of 5 star standard. Nothing was a problem, we stayed five nights. My wife was sick on the Sunday and one of the staff put a food tray together for us as we couldn't go out and the restaurant was closed it was wonderful service thankyou all the staff at Keppler.

Reviews.Title: “One of the better hotels in Paris but extra space is at a premium”
Reviews.Author: LondonTelegramSam
Reviews.Content: What makes this hotel stand out is the superb quality of the state in which it is maintained - this is not a large chain hotel where ebitda is more important than the wear and tear maintenance. The staff are also very good, so ehwta bordering on the in trusive in their eagerness to help but they remain professional. Like most (all?) Paris hotels everything is too small, the lobby, the rooms, the side-street on which it is etc.The hotel also has no extra services except for a small sauna in the basment (no restaurant, pool) . But for a business traveller who has no budget issues it is one of the better hotels in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Annoyed”
Reviews.Author: footnotesetc
Reviews.Content: We had booked a "Standard Room", with lovely pink pillows shown on the hotel website– but when we checked in, we were taken to the smaller, "Classic Room". Naturally, we were annoyed because we had booked the more expensive room, the "Standard". We protested, but the gentleman at the front desk was unmoved. Finally, someone else intervened, gave us another room which was more spacious. Still, it was unpleasant and we would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stylish stay”
Reviews.Author: Silver69
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the hotel having read excellent reviews on Tripadvisor and we weren't disappointed. The hotel communal areas (including the bar area) are small but super stylish, the service was super and the staff extremely friendly. The room we had was very small even though it was an upgrade from the basic room however it was spotlessly clean and immaculately decorated - this size of room tho is typical of Paris and I felt it was value for money. The bar was expensive but we found that in general Paris was very expensive especially with the current low exchange rate. Oscars restaurant recommended by the hotel was very good - the Keppler does not have it's own restaurant which is one of the negatives the other, for me, being the lack of tea/coffee making facilities in the room. All in all though this was a very good hotel in a central location and represented good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to the title of a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonCho
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend took me here for my birthday and it was lovely! Great location (right near George V metro)minutes from the Arc. Service/reception was lovely. They couldn't do enough for us. We didn't eat or drink there so couldn't comment but the hotel did suggest places where we could go and the reception was 24 hours I think (it was open when we came back from a late romantic walk). I agree the rooms were super small but when you're in Paris you're not going to be in your room for long (well, if you are you don't need more than the bed!) The fixtures/furnishings didn't feel dated or tired. Only small minor issue was that we couldn't alter the air con(it wouldn't go down past a certain level as it was Winter) but oh well - we lived! Basically I'd go again and I'm a fussy cow!

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: twickersWestSussex
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Keppler for our 25th Wedding Anniversary for 3 nights in an executive room on the 3rd floor and I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone The hotel arranged for flowers, champagne and chocolates in the room as I had requested and the staff and service from all was first class whilst being welcoming and personal (particulary the breakfast staff). The breakfast room and lounge area`s are beautiful and relaxing and as we are both in the interior design / fit-out industry we were very impressed with the decor and quality of finishes throughout the hotel I had spent what seemed like hours researching on the internet to find a hotel to stay in to celebrate this special occassion and as our last trip to Paris had been some 25 years earlier as part of our honeymoon I was somewhat nervous as to where to stay, however, the description and images on the Keppler`s website are just as it was and I can only confirm the positive comments which others have already said about this hotel. Stay here and you will not be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GigsNJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights (2 at beginning of France stay and 2 at end). Absolutely a great hotel! Outstanding help from the front desk, beautiful lobby and rooms. Great location near the Metro and the Arc. Great breakfast! Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kns83
Reviews.Content: Everything about The Hotel Keppler is first class. Great location, great staff, wonderful rooms. I would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “An intimate stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: traveling_crow
Reviews.Content: We immensly enjoyed our stay in Paris at Hotel Keppler. The hotel had a great location on a small side street just a couple blocks from the Arc de Triomphe. The decor was lovely, the hotel had many many amenities and the service excellent. The only downside was the size of the rooms, which ran on the small aside, although this tends to hold true for most, if not all, Paris hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but small room...”
Reviews.Author: sheldon128
Reviews.Content: We wanted to book through mr and mrs smith as we had vouchers. However, there was an excellent deal on skoosh.com. Mr and mrs SMith refused to match it. So I emailed the hotel, who confirmed the skoosh offer, and contacted Mr and Mrs Smith for me, and told them to match it. Very Impressive service. The service at the desk pre arrival and during stay was excellent, and the furnishings immaculate and very tasteful. We stayed in a basic room and it was well furnished, with a well equipped bathroom. The location was excellent, being within a 5 minute walk of 3 tube stations, Champs_Elysee and Arc. The "Buts" - the bedroom was tiny (i'm told this is the norm for Paris). The double bed barely squeezed in. Breakfast was not that great compared to other hotel breakfasts. The dining area is small, and the waitresses were rushed and unable to give a good level of service. We didnt think the quality of croissants and bread was particularly good. Overall a nice hotel, but I certainly wouldnt pay the hotel internet rate for the rooms - I think they are expensive for what you get. However, if you can get a good deal, I think its a great little hotel

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic! You will not be disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: LeroyEngland
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Keppler for our 25th anniversary for 3 days, the whole experience was the best ever, when we saw the hotel and all the facilities it was our dream come true. We stayed in a suite (Room 504) and the brochure and pictures met all our expectations, it is a 4* hotel with 5* facilities. The location was fantastic and very sensual. It was a 5 minute walk to the Des Champs Élysées, 5 minutes to Arc De Triomphe. The hotel staff were fantastic, especially Annabelle, the reservations manager and the porter Shyamon, but they were all good and were only too happy to help. Truly a memorable experience and I would not hesitate in returning . The area was surrounded by many places to eat, so there was easy access to a restaurant at all times , shop around though, as Paris is very expensive. We took a boat trip along the river Seine and this was an ideal way to do sight seeing. The Eiffel Tower was about 15 minute walk, however, be prepared for long queuing. The service in the hotel was excellent and could not be faulted, our room came with a complimentary bottle of Champagne and nibbles, a huge bed, robes, and all the usual things you would expect if you were in he UK, plus more. Overall, the hotel, the location, and the service given by the staff was immaculate and really made our stay enjoyable and worth while. I spent days looking through trip adviser and finally choose the Keppler and what a good choice. Very Highly recommended! We will DEFINITELY stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: sputnikx
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing 4 day stay at the Keppler. The rooms are absolutely gorgeous with a lot of love to details and even though they are very small it was extremely cozy and we enjoyed every second of it. This is actually the fist hotel where the photos on the hotel website are 100% accurate to what you see in person once you arrive at the room. The location was fantastic - in the 16th arrondissement sandwiched between the Eiffel tower and the Arc de triomphe just 2 minutes of the Champs Élysées. The area itself around the hotel is nice and elegant but not very touristy (few hotels in the area even though it's just a stone throw off Champs-Élysées and the Arc de triomphe) and is in the embassy district, so food was excellent - and with a lot of locals in the restaurant everything was very relaxed and it felt like a real Paris experience. We were recommended a few bistros and restaurants by the Hotel and all of them were outstanding. The service in the hotel was excellent and very personalized and our room came with a nice buffet breakfast. We had a glass of Champagne in the winter garden and it was quite an unforgettable experience. The only thing I can actually think off as not perfect was the fact that on Sundays all guests seem to go at the same time to the breakfast room which reaches capacity pretty fast and we had to wait a few minutes until we were seated. All in all this is probably the best little boutique hotel we have ever stayed and I would recommend the place to everybody who wants to have an unforgettable stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Paris”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrotter010
Reviews.Content: After many hours of trying to decide on the right place to stay in Paris we opted for Hotel Keppler. Previous reviews had been good and it had a special offer on with Mr & Mrs Smith. Our previous stay in Paris had been very disappointing so I was determined to make sure we got it right this time. Getting to the point the hotel was perfect. The hotel itself is a few roads back off the Champs Elysees in a quiet street. So very central to all places of interest. We stayed in a Executive room. It was spotlessly clean, bright, airy. Also wonderfully decorated and a reasonable size for Paris. One thing very important to me is a comfortable bed and Hotel Keppler got full marks. The hotel website captures the hotel exactly. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The small fitness room was adequate for a work out. Cross trainer, running machine and a bike with a bench and stand of free weights. Breakfast was fantastic, cooked breakfast or omelettes, cereals, fresh fruits , cold meats and cheeses etc. Will certainly return!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: RoadsterMan
Reviews.Content: This really is a gem. Beautifully appointed and in an ideal location close to Champs Elysee. We were upgraded to a geogeous suite on 4th floor that was quiet and discreet, and had little to complain about. Only minor problem is the very small breakfast room, although the breakfast itself is very good. We will likely keep this as our regular haunt in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Fivestarsuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in August. I have read all the reviews about it and everything positive is true. I really can't add much more to what has already been said. The perfect manners and charm of the staff is exceptional. We particularly liked Simon from Sri Lanka who served drinks in the bar at night. Nothing was too much trouble. He was lovely. The only downside of such a top location was that the restaurants nearby are extremely expensive. We spent a long time looking for reasonably priced evening meals. We can recommend one in Rue Marceau called "Comptoir de L'Arc." It was full of lively, local, French people ( always a good sign) and although the tables are very close together ( that's the way it is), we had a steak meal each and half a carafe of wine for 36 euros, which we thought was OK in the Champs Elysee area. If you would like a teatime treat, visit Laduree on the Champs Elysee. It's expensive, but the service, tea and patisserie are "to die for." Finally, Hotel Keppler richly deserves its position as 4th best hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with very small rooms !!”
Reviews.Author: Maxiiie
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend in Keppler in an Executive room. The room was very small but nice decorated! The bathroom was not that big with a tv in the mirror. The breakfast was very good! Wide selection of french breads and fruits ! The location is very good ( Five minutes from Champs Elysees ) The bath products ( Shampoo, soap,..) Were not filled by in the Three days ! That you wouldn't expect in a Four star boutique hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot In A Great City”
Reviews.Author: gringoboy
Reviews.Content: A great weekend in Paris, and a lovely hotel. We were there for my partners 40th, and the Hotel sent up a nice bottle of Champagne to our room. It was a nice touch. The room was smallish, but not too bad by Parisian standards and more than enough. Very nice decor and comfy beds, and an excellent shower. The staff are very helpful if you need them, and breakfast is first class. Nothing negative to say about this place. Literally a stones throw from the Arc and the Champs Elysee, it could hardly be better placed yet is peaceful. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect. Absolutely Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: jonat509
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about this hotel. The reviews are accurate. This location was perfect for us. A quiet street only a 4 minute walk to Champs D´Elysee and the Arc de Triomph. More importantly, only a 4 minute walk to the Metro, which will get you anywhere within 15 minutes max. The room was spotless, the front desk was extremely helpful and courteous. The breakfast was particularly enjoyable. We would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely superb experience”
Reviews.Author: Bim66London
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Keppler for three nights in July with my family- 3 kids aged 9, 7 and 3. Our stay was perfect- the hotel is wonderful, in a great location and the staff are very friendly and helpful. My wife and children loved the experience. The beds were very comfortable, the showers I have never had better and the hotel breakfast cannot be beaten- everything you want is catered for. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, quiet boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: T-on-Tour
Reviews.Content: Having been disappointed by the hotels in Paris on my previous visits (expensive, cramped and often dirty). I was determined to stay in a hotel with well appointed rooms, friendly and efficient service and a decent breakfast whilst being in a central location. The Hotel Keppler did not disappoint. We got a great deal through Airmiles and stayed in a standard double room on the 3rd floor. The room was nicely decorated, clean and although on the small side it was very well organised so that we never felt that the space was insufficient. We had a shower cubicle rather than a bath with a powerful rain shower. The bathroom was supplied with nice toiletries and a proper hairdryer. The air conditioning was very effective and quiet although it was directed at your head when in bed (which I found a little annoying). The staff were very friendly and welcoming and although we didn't have the need to ask for assistance, I am sure they would have been helpful. The breakfast was lovely with a range of cold meats, selection of cheese, sausages, pancakes, scrambled egg, bacon, boiled eggs, cereal, fruit salad and fresh fruit. Coffee/tea and a basket of delicious pastries were given to us directly at the table. The hotel is in a quiet side street which is great if you're a light sleeper. I was initially looking for a hotel on the left bank but nothing seemed as good as the Hotel Keppler within the same price range. Also, the proximity to George V metro and the fact that the Seine is a comfortable walking distance meant that the location was fine for us. I would definitely recommend this hotel although I'm not sure if I would have been as pleased if we had paid the full rate for the standard room.

Reviews.Title: “The best lovely boutique hotel with incredible stuff in Paris”
Reviews.Author: whitelotus7
Reviews.Content: I was searching so hard to find the best hotel in Paris for my mother’s birthday and I found it!!! The hotel keppler was lovely boutique hotel with very friendly & impressive stuff. We had such a great time in Paris from our first day to the end (7 days). Our room was very nice and clean with wonderful interior. The hotel location was amazing. It’s very close to the metro station (Georges V) and you can walk to the Champs-Elyseesthe and Effel tower(15-20min). Also, there are many places you can take a nice walk around it. The best thing is that you can ask any questions to the stuff there, they are so kind and help you until you get satisfied. I had such a wonderful time in Paris! I will be staying at the hotel keppler again next time when I visit Paris for sure, because I know there is no other hotel like it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant little gem”
Reviews.Author: Drujon
Reviews.Content: The Keppler is a very nice, quiet respite from the hustle and bustle of Paris! The interior decor is very snazzy and it was like staying at a very stylish friends town house. The room was small, but expected, the details were exquisite and even though it only had a shower only, the bath was very luxurious. The staff was very pleasant , especially the barman. I would skip room service - it's just take out from a cafe around the corner, but moring coffee, tea and pastry were fine.

Reviews.Title: “Made our trip to Paris perfect. Fabulous hotel.”
Reviews.Author: qtsteph
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Keppler for 2 nights from 07th August. The trip was a gift for my boyfriend who has very high standards so i was a little worried! The hotel surpassed all expectation and my boyfriend was thrilled with it. The decor was amazing and we were upgraded to a suite (room 601) which was just fabulous with the best bed ive ever slept in. We had a large balcony with sun lounger and table, electric blinds, electric roof canopy and view of the eiffel tower. Seperate sitting room and big bathroom all fabulously decorated with a TV in the mirror! Breakfast was good value and we had it in on our balcony both mornings over looking the roof tops of Paris. The reception were very helpful when we needed anything and the location meant we could walk easily to lots of places. We will 100% stay here again on our next trip to Paris. If your looking for a boutique hotel in a great loaction this has to be it!

Reviews.Title: “For high-concept lovers”
Reviews.Author: Rochl
Reviews.Content: This is a high-design hotel that has been reviewed in design competitions. Everything is done in black and white. Very impressive. We had a spacious double room with elegant adjoining bath. The room was larger than is typical of many European hotels. Staff was very attentive and helpful. Hotel is in a fashionable and expensive part of town (near Georges V and the Champs-Elysees). Breakfast (included) was very good. I would stay there again if I can afford it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastique! The most lovely boutique hotel....”
Reviews.Author: SMKNewYork
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Keppler the second to the last week in July. We could not have been more pleased. The hotel is immaculate from the charming lobby to the room itself. The entire staff was always polite, helpful and welcoming. Our room had such a comfy bed and lovely pillows...I usually travel with my own but not needed here! Location could not be better just a short walk from Louis Vuitton. We had lovely breakfast in their -1 floor on 2 of the mornings and although it was slightly pricy for what it was, this is Paris and so I expected that--but in truth, I can say nothing negative in fact I will stay there again because I know it is a sure thing!

Reviews.Title: “The George V Without The Hefty Bill”
Reviews.Author: stabbaa
Reviews.Content: It was a while since I visited Paris, and frankly I was lost as to where to stay.... All I can say is that was thrilled with the experience. The hotel is new, super clean, the design is trendy yet still with a french touch. The staff are incredibly welcoming and helpful. I Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A Five Star Treatment”
Reviews.Author: stabbaa
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel....In the heart of Paris. It has all the feel & goodies of a 5 star without the real hefty price tag. I would most surely visit it again and would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms, slow shower drainage, uneven service”
Reviews.Author: Emily07
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews from 50+ hotels in Paris, I decided to go with Hotel Keppler. First impression: we arrived at noon and was told that our room would not be available until 7pm because the guest occupying the room was very sick. #1: 7pm check-in is unacceptable, #2: why would we want to stay in a room where someone was VERY sick in? Next they told us we could check-in earlier, but when we arrived in the room, we knew immediately it was not what we reserved (bed was smaller, room was smaller, decor style was obviously a standard room). So we had to go downstairs to the reception again. The check-in manager quickly said that he would reduce the rate by 60 euros. My point is, they obviously couldn't arrange the category of room we reserved and instead of saying honestly that they were putting us in a lower category room and adjusting our rate, they tried to just let it slip by. That's not the kind of service we were expecting. The amount of stress we experienced upon first entering the hotel would definitely deter me from going back. Other details: Yes, hotel is close to Champs Elysees however, the street is very small and quiet at night. A little bit difficult to find in the dark. Room had no luggage racks (they said they would deliver one but never did). The room had virtually no space to accommodate two opened luggages (we had to keep one closed at any point in time). Shower drainage was slow, after a 10 minute shower, there would be 2 inches of water at your feet. Bedding: pillows were airy soft (lacking support), red stain on decorative duvet over the bed. One thing that we really enjoyed: breakfast: both the service and the food quality was excellent. So make sure they include breakfast in your rate.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel, in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: britsabroadUk
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience staying at Hotel Keppler, we found the hotel to be very comfortable with rooms of an adequate size ,well equipped and tastefully decorated. The bathroom was well equipped , including toiletries , slippers & bathrobes. The mirror with tv insert was an unexpected novelty !! The staff were all very helpful and pleasant, going out of their way to ensure we had an enjoyable stay. A good selection of fresh produce every morning for breakfast, with all tastes catered for. Hotel Keppler is situated just a couple of streets from Champs Elysees, a five minute stroll to Arc de Triomphe and 10 minutes to the Seine and Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and Chic Hotel Keppler”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravelPlanner
Reviews.Content: We were somewhat hesitant to stay at Hotel Keppler because we were afraid of losing the neighborhood feeling we have had when staying in the Latin Quarter or Luxembourg area. However, we were delighted with Keppler's location! We enjoyed an excellent neighborhood restaurant (Oscar's) at Phillipe's recommendation. Plus, Keppler is just a few blocks from the Arc de Triomph. We had also been hesitant because it is decorated in black and white-- we thought that might be a bit harsh. I have to say, the decoration at the hotel was anything but harsh--- it was brilliantly decorated, and suffused with an eclectic style. Our room was not too small by European or American standards--- it was spacious and comfortable. I also must say, the bed at Keppler is the most comfortable I have ever had in Europe! Our room was quiet at all times. We have stayed abroad a number of times, and we often stay at very nice hotels, but Keppler is by far the most comfortable. The service was wonderful. The breakfast was excellent. The amenities (including a television in the bathroom mirror) were all luxury quality. We had an excellent stay, would stay here again, and recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: MDennis
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself came to Paris for a romantic long weekend. We could not have picked a better hotel to stay in! Only 5 min walk from Arc de triomphe and 10 mins from Eiffel Tower. Perfect. The hotel it self is truelly a little gem with all members of staff right from the cleaners up to the management being friendly and made you feel very welcome. Special thanks has to go to Philippe the head concierge there who really made our trip to Paris. Nothing was too much hassle. The private use of the steam and sauna room was a real bonus and the breakast that is supplied is not only fresh but there is plenty of it. On the second day we decided to have it in our room which they didn't mind us doing. Stay here if you are after something special!! You won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Phantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ItalydreamerCh
Reviews.Content: Beautiful boutique hotel with friendly and efficient staff. Our executive room was lovely and clean and the breakfast was great. A good location for someone who wants to be near Champs Elysee. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better!”
Reviews.Author: trainwreck31
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Keppler is a small, clean, comfortable hotel very near the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs-Elysees shopping and cafes. But most remarkable about this wonderful hotel is the staff. Everyone from the concierge to housekeeping was genuinely kind and helpful. The breakfast spread includes fresh fruit, a cheese tray, pastries and linen on the tables. In two weeks and three cities in Europe, the Hotel Keppler was the best of our accommodations and we cannot say enough about it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stones7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Keppler for a long weekend break in Paris with my Girlfriend in March 2009, and we both thought it was wonderful. Firstly, we were upgraded to a small suite on our arrival, which was a really unexpected bonus. The suite had a small balcony, and a view of the Eiffel Tower - OK it wasn't the whole tower, but it was really nice to sit out drinking a coffee in the morning, looking over the rooftops of Paris, with the Eiffel Tower in the distance. The room itself was divided into a sitting area, a bedroom, a walk-in wardrobe/dressing area and a bathroom. It wasn't the biggest room I've ever stayed in, that's for sure, but it was stylishly decorated, clean, comfortable and cozy. It also featured all the amenties you'd expect from a modern hotel. The facilities at the hotel were good, but as it's a small hotel converted from a old Parisienne residence, then all the facilities are also small. It has a small bar area, a small breakfast room, a small gym etc. But whilst all are small, they're also perfectly formed. Therefore adding to the ambience of the stay. The continental breakfast buffet is also very good, with a wide selection. The staff were efficient and very friendly, and really made a huge difference to our enjoyment of our trip. Not just with the upgrade, but they handled a delivery for me efficiently, and made dinner reservations at 2 good local restaurants on our behalf, as well as being generally friendly; greeting us every time we came back to the hotel, or stopping for a quick chat to discuss our plans for the day etc. On previous visits to Paris I could never quite understand why people fell so much in love with the city, but having now stayed at the Hotel Keppler where we did not experience any of the 'Parisienne attitude' I can now totally understand the romance and lure of the city, and we'll definitely be going back in the future, and we'll stay at the Hotel Keppler when we do.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel...like a B&B but in a city setting! Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: pfasciano
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights @ Hotel Keppler in Mid-May....service was fantastic....I was having trouble making local calls from my room to confirm reservations for a wine tasting event and dinner cruise event and the lovely & helpful Anabel at reception not only showed me how to make the calls, but she actually make them for me while I waited! She was very sweet and so helpful! Executive Room was plenty big...windows were big too and opened to the courtyard, AC worked great...bathroom was BEAUTIFUL! Location....get ready to walk, but there are 2 major Metro lines in close range. You'll be @ the Louis Vuitton store on the Champs Elyse in less than 5 minutes walking...the Metro is right there. This was a GREAT place...thanks to many of the reviews I read here before I went.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JBX7
Reviews.Content: I booked the Keppler Hotel after a lot of research - my husband and I have been to Paris before and had a horrible hotel so I knew I would need to go for a four or five star hotel to get the standard we required. We were celebrating our 30th Wedding Anniverary so I wanted somewhere luxurious. I was not disappointed with this hotel. It is spotlessly clean and very modern. The pictures on the website are identical to the rooms. We were upgraded to an executive room after the first night in a standard room. The standard room was very small almost claustraphobic! The executive room was a good size and had a bath which was missing in the standard room. (A bath is essential in Paris as you do so much walking you need a good soak when you return from sightseeing). There was a television in the bathroom but its volume didn't function so I asked the concierge to have a look but he forgot. It wasn't that important. The breakfast is very good with a good selction of fruit , cereal, cold meats, cheeses and pastries along with a buffet style hot selection each day. The staff are exceptional and make this hotel stand out from others. Nothing was too much trouble. Their recommendations for restaurants, although pricey, were all fantastic. Le Christine on Rue Christine (LatinQuarter) was very good and well worth a visit. The metro stations are all within easy walking distance and situated on the Champs Elysee (about 5 mins walk away). Location wise the hotel is on a quiet street. Quite a walk from all the major tourist sites but very accessible by the metro. The Champs Elysee and The Arc de Triomphe are very close. The one downer was on our last morning when we awoke to find no hot water from the taps. We phoned reception to ask why; they were unaware of the problem and phoned an engineer. This was our last day and our 30th wedding anniversary !! We had to check out without having a shower or a bath and returned home . The receptionist was very apologetic and wiped our bar bill from a previous night as a goodwill gesture. All in all a fabulous hotel with exceptional staff. We would go back again when next in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: August111
Reviews.Content: Great! I came here for business and the hotel is very nice. Staff are friendly, helpful and informative.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding - if not for the location, it would be perfect”
Reviews.Author: NYCtraveler1500
Reviews.Content: I was so delighted by the quality of everything in this hotel - from the elegant reception to the beautiful rooms (small but nothing unusual for Paris), to the lovely design details everywhere and the practical, high-quality amenities (good closet and dresser space, good lighting, great shower, nice mini-bar, good-size safe, full length mirror, very good towels and decent bed) . If it was located in the 6th or 7th, this hotel would be perfect (of course, then it would be twice the cost). Service is absolutely stellar. The location is safe and not bad really - just not as central as I'd like. If you need or want to be in the neighborhood of the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees - it's definitely the perfect place to stay - a true jewel box. That said, it's an excellent value and worth a bit more walking (or metro) time if you have the time to spare. This is an excellent, classic, boutique city hotel. (If you're looking for something more romantic, particularly Parisian, and in a better location - check out L'Hotel, which I tried on this same trip and also reviewed. I loved both of these hotels - but they're very, very different.)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience, great hotel & service!”
Reviews.Author: ddl427
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Keppler for 2 nights and absolutely had the best experience from the start. We arrived 2 hours b, duefore check-in, as our flight arrived in the late AM. We were able to check in early (only minor issue was that the paperwork reflected a standard room when we booked and paid for the 1 bdrm executive, but this was quickly resolved and we got the executive), and were treated with much kindness, esp after our long flight from the US. Service: The bell hop (Philip) and concierge (Phillip) were very helpful with restaurant reservations and direction guidance both days, as well as prompt taxi service whenever we needed one. We had the breakfast service on our last morning and again (yummie food!), the staff and service were outstanding. Location: The location is terrific as well..close to the Arc de Triomphe, Champs de Elysees, Eiffel and more. We opted for taxi service at night for our dinner plans but during the day, we walked the city for the most part. Getting lost in the area is quite fun. Decor: The hotel is very contemporary, fresh, charming with lots of character. What you see from their website is what you get - we absolutely felt comfortable and at home here! The decor was one of the main reasons we booked our stay, as it is very modern and chic, not like many of hotels that we researched that seemed a bit outdated with flowering decor, etc.. Although the room was a bit small, it was not a surprised, based on all the hotel reviews I've read online about European hotels. The decor was again, modern and fresh. The bathroom was clean and the tv in the bathroom mirror was a nice touch. All in all, we really enjoyed our stay at Keppler and we cannot wait to come back to Paris and stay here again! 4 thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Tasteful hotel, great service and attention to detail without pretention”
Reviews.Author: SophsterBath_England
Reviews.Content: My other half took me Paris as a late Valentines Day treat. After a little searching (we got off the Metro at George V, but we later found out that Charles De Gaule - Etoile is better) we found the Hotel Keppler on a very quiet street. We were welcomed and taken to our room. I was expecting it to be small, so I was under no illusions. That said, the room uses its space well. The Bathroom was my favourite. We brought a bottle of Champagne with us, and it was nice to sit and soak in the tub, whilst my partner sat on the toilet (not 'on it'!) and drank with me. The breakfast was lovely, and I didn't know where to start first. I liked the saucisson and brie (something I would never have for breakfast back home). The staff were very helpful, recommending restaurants for us and printing out maps and addresses for us to follow. The Hotel Keppler is handy for the Champs Elysees, particularly the Arch De Triomph end. Drugstore Publiscis and Lauderee were both fairly close, and with several Metro stations close-by, you can get almost everywhere in Paris fairly quickly. Beds were very comfy and the water was hot. All in all, I think that this was a great hotel and would diffenately return, if only for some interior design ideas! By the way, the street was so quite that I think I only heard 3 cars go down it all weekend.

Reviews.Title: “An absolutely wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: JetsetterVirginia
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip therefore; we decided to review trip advisor for hotel reviews. My boyfriend found Hotel Keppler on another site and I knew the best way to find out about it would be to check trip advisor. Based on the reviews we decided to stay at Hotel Keppler. We had already done our research and knew to expect smaller rooms than what we are used to in the U.S. All I can say is everything about the hotel was wonderful. We were upgraded to an executive suite which was quaint and beautifully decorated. The staff is extremely helpful and patient since I could only speak a few words in French. They recommended places to eat and gave us directions on how to get to many locations. The location is close to major tourist attractions but far enough away to offer peace and tranquility. We plan on returning to Paris and will definitely stay at Hotel Keppler again.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful!”
Reviews.Author: AandRMazer
Reviews.Content: Several weeks ago we had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Keppler for 5 nights when we took my 21 year old daughter to Paris to celebrate her birthday. The location was great for us and I liked that it was located on a side, and not a busy, street. The Champs Elysees was really close and in Paris you walk everywhere anyway. I had confirmed an Executive room with an extra bed for our daughter. I know that European hotels are small and I thought I had done my research but, honestly, 5 nights with an extra bed at the end of the larger bed would have given us no room to move aound (which would have been okay for 1 night but not for 5). Luckily a Deluxe Suite with a Terrace was available and we happily upgraded to that. My daughter slept on the fold-out couch in the living room (enjoying her privacy) which was separated from the bedroom by pocket doors. The terrace was fabulous with it's view of the Eiffel Tower! We were all blown away! All the rooms we saw were gorgeously decorated. I have rarely met such a warm and professional staff. There was nothing they could not do for us. Because of the size of this property (39 rooms I believe) there is a nice, intimate, feeling to it. They recommended Laduree on the Champs Elysees for one evening when we didn't want a huge meal (of course we brought back their famous macaroons!) and Oscars (several block from the hotel), a neighborhood restaurant another night. Both were great! I will dream of visiting Paris again and will definitely choose the Hotel Keppler!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: svl_9
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from a 3-day break at the Keppler and we absolutely loved it! From the moment we arrived the staff could not do enough to ensure our comfort and overall enjoyment of our stay. Hotel environment: This really felt like a boutique hotel. The decor was modern without being tacky and there was a real attention to detail. Everything was just so clean and in perfect condition. The reception area is beautiful and our classic room was very stylish and comfortable. The room was adequate in size, considering the typical size of Paris accommodation. The sound insulation was also great - we remained completely undisturbed throughout our stay. We made use of the Hammam and Sauna while we were there and it felt like a private spa! I think the only slight criticism would be that the shower in our room was not very powerful, but hot water was plentiful and that really is a minor criticism in the spirit of giving a balanced review! Breakfast: Breakfast was available from 8-11am, which was very convenient. There was lots of good food on offer and I'm sure the extended choice would cater to most tastes. The breakfast room is also beautifully decorated, in keeping with the rest of the hotel. Location: We have visited Paris on 5 previous occasions and have primarily stayed in St Germain area, which we love. Although this remains our favourite district, the Keppler is in a great location on the Right Bank, very near to the Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees. The metro is a 5 minute walk away, so the rest of Paris is very accessible too. At night, the area is quiet and feels very safe. Staff: The staff were very helpful throughout our stay - not something that we have always found during our stays in Paris! Phillipe on reception deserves a special mention. We were going to a gig in the suburbs of Paris one night and he did a lot of research on our behalf into bus and train timetables! This really was invaluable to us and I don't know how we could have managed without him. We also mentioned that we were going shopping on our last day, upon which he promptly gave us a discount card for some of the stores we had mentioned! I don't think we've received better service anywhere else. Overall, we couldn't recommend the Keppler highly enough. We have stayed in many nice hotels and this ranks among the best.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: TigerHoods
Reviews.Content: Perferct Location, Perfect Service, Perfect trip to Paris!!!! After a very friendly warm welcome from the staff at the Keppler Hotel we were advised that for the first night we would be staying in the sister hotel 'Francois' about 500 yards away. At first we were not too sure about this, but we were told we would be upgraded for the second night which would be in the Keppler Hotel. A member of staff carried our bags and walked us to the Francois Hotel to help check us in and what a pleasant surprise we got. The hotel is outstanding from all aspects, how a previous review could complain is beyond me as we loved this! The Francois Hotel is a beautiful boutique hotel that was tastefully furnished, immaculately clean, with friendly staff who can't do enough for you. The room itself was very traditional and comfortable and if we told we would be staying a second night, we wouldn't have complained!! The following morning after breakfast (which was lovely by the way), we mentioned to the manager that we would be staying at the Keppler Hotel for the second night and he was aware of this and told us everything would be taken care of. After our day in Paris we arrived in the Keppler Hotel around 6pm to find we had been upgraded to an executive suite, with complementary champagne and our luggage was awaiting us in the room. Again the Hotel was beautiful if a little more modern style with staff who did everything you asked with a smile. This hotel although close to the Champs Elysees was wonderfully quiet and relaxing, the room itself was big, comfortable and clean and was perfect for our needs. When we returned from our evening out the staff had turned the bed down, dimmed the lights put classical music on the TV which for our last night in Paris was fantastic. Everything about these hotels was perfect, we were looked after from start to finish and couldn't ask anymore from the management or the staff. We would definately recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to visit Paris as it is perfect location and simply wonderful!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: ilovecheesecake
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at the Hotel Keppler. We have travelled all over the U.S. Europe and the Caribbean/Mexico and I can honestly say that I have never stayed in a hotel with such a sophisticated eye for detail as Hotel Keppler. They have thought of absolutely everything. The decor throughout the hotel is breathtaking. I just sat in the reception area and had tea a couple of times and looked around at the wonderful design. We had an executive room for 2 adults and 2 little girls. It was beautiful and state of the art. A high def television in the mirror of the bathroom. A hight def flat screen on the desk in the bedroom. The bed was heavenly and the room was completely soundproof. The breakfast was delicious. The selection was great and everything was wonderful. I don't see how anyone could complain. They had fresh squeezed oj or grapefruit juice every morning along with many hot and cold selections. The servers were willing to bend over backwards to make sure everything was perfect. There is an asian man who works in many different capacities including bellman. He was wonderful. On 2 different occasions when I had tea my 2 daughters were with me. He was so kind to them. He brought out an extra tea cup for them and a tray of goodies for them to share. They felt very special. Everyone at the hotel was exceptional. The fitness center is great and the computer convenient as well. We would not hesitate to stay at the Hotel Keppler the next time we are in Paris. We booked on GTAHotels.com and feel that we got a good rate. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service makes all the difference”
Reviews.Author: Double-Os
Reviews.Content: We went on a romantic weekend in Paris and wanted to stay at a modern boutique hotel. After reading many reviews on several web sites, we decided to go with Hotel Keppler, which has proven to be a great choice. We booked a traditional suite, but got upgraded on our arrival to the superior suite. The service was impeccable. We continuously asked the staff for recommendations (shopping, restaurants, etc.) and they never disappointed. We were always greeted with a smile, and a genuine attempt to make our stay as pleasant as possible. The suite we stayed in was terrific, very well designed and well equipped. Size-wise, It's not like a superior suite in Vegas, but Paris has different size standards (we already knew what to expect). We certainly recommend this hotel to anyone who is visiting Paris, and would be happy to come back to Hotel Keppler.

Reviews.Title: “We Warmly Recommend The Keppler !”
Reviews.Author: SelloParis
Reviews.Content: I booked the Keppler hotel because my friends stayed there last year and they loved it. We had booked an executive room package from the hotels website and I found it very practical. (it was nice to have all the little extras that the package offered) We found the room a good size and it was such fun to have the TV in the bathroom as well. The hotel was extremely clean and the all the staff was attentive and always ready to help. We know Paris pretty well and we wanted to visit different places than the normal tourist things. The reception staff made fantastic recommendations and we had dinners only in the restaurants were the real Parisian go. The location of Keppler is great. Just 2 minutes and you are in the Champs Elysees and George V. We appreciated to be able to have late breakfast every day at 11am. There was nothing that was too much asked from the staff. They were wonderful and spoke good English (which is not always the case) We used the fitness and the sauna, which are rare to find in a small hotel. (especially in Paris) This little gem is worth going. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful hotel; elegant, sparkling clean & perfect location”
Reviews.Author: LeaCW
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Keppler this past week while in Paris and couldn't have made a better choice of hotels. Spotlessly clean, extremely professional helpful staff, fantastic location. There is a building currently being remodeled directly opposite the hotel, so we were worried about the construction noise, but since it was chilly, we kept the windows closed and couldn't hear a thing through them. Breakfast was wonderful and plentiful, hot food as well cold smoked salmon and delicious pastries. Internet was very expensive so we did not use it, but it was available for 22 Euro per day, or 8 Euro per hour to use the hotel computer. Lovely little fitness center but also did not have a chance to use it. The decor and furnishing were extremely tasteful and well done.

Reviews.Title: “Compact but lovely”
Reviews.Author: cashew_nut
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from a weekend in Paris and had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Keppler. We were trying to stick to a tight budget so only booked a 'classic room' which is, as you'd imagine, pretty small. Even though we would have preferred more space, it was immaculate and quiet so fine for us. Location we felt was perfect - close to the Champs Elysee on a pretty Parisien street. To be honest, in Paris most of the sights are walking distance and there are metro's everywhere! My only gripe with the hotel was that we couldn't turn our heating off so had to sleep with the window open (apparently they don't provide air con until summer starts). I was also a little disappointed with breakfast...On a final positive note, the concierge was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Can see why this hotel is one of the best rated in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: KKNNGG
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at Hotel Keppler from 5th-8th Feb & it was wonderful. It is in an Ideal location & has extremely curtious & professional staff . The hotel is immaculate & beautifully decorated. We booked via alpharooms for an executive room, we experienced no problems with the alpharooms booking although we did check with the hotel proir to arrival. Our room was to a very high standard & extremely spacious. The breakfast is so wonderful I would like to return just for this one aspect. Room service was a bit strange as it seemed to be ordered in from outside the hotel but was adequate as something to eat the night we arrived & the only other minor problem was that there was no tea or coffee facilities in our room. The hotel recommended a lovely little French Bistro Restaurant about 5 minutes walk away called Oscars, we would highly recommend. Would return tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: ZakRichardson
Reviews.Content: Booked (3 nights - Friday through to Monday) this hotel for first wedding anniversary and birthday after doing extensive research. On arrival we were advised by Hotel Manager that they could not accommodate us until the Sunday (last night). The reason given for this was due a leak in our room. I asked the Manager to show me the room and he showed me a standard room that did not have a leak. I stated to the Manager that we had booked an Executive room so I didn't understand why a "leak" in a standard room would adversely impact on our booking. I did not receive a satisfactory response to my question and I then asked the Manager what hotel he had booked us into for the Friday and Saturday. He advised me and I asked another member of staff to put the hotel on Tripadvisor. The hotel was rated approximately 650 places lower than the Keppler. I advised the Manager that this was totally unsatisfactory. To this he locked himself in his office and then rang another member of his staff to say that we had been completely de-booked and booked into the afore mentioned hotel. I have travelled extensively globally and this is by far the worst experience I have had.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: docmiami
Reviews.Content: Great place for couples. I booked the hotel through www.otel.com. (rate was better than booking through the hotel website and allows you to book the executive room at a decent rate) It is a small boutique hotel, rooms are new, a bit small so i recommend you get an executive room. Breakfast is superb, so get the package with breakfast. Location is excellent (3-4 blocks from Champ de Elysees, close by metro station, many things in walking distance). I decided to write the review because I always use independent reviews to book hotels I have never been to, and this was the only hotel in Paris without a negative review (and now I understand why). Taxi drivers often confuses Rue Keppler with Rue Kebbler. I suggest you print a map from the hotel website and give it to the cab driver. By the way, if you like Indian food there is a great Indian place (Ratn) few blocks from the hotel.....delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Farmertomless
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel in an excellent Location. We also had booked an executive double room with Alpha rooms. The hotel only had us booked for a standard room luckily they were able to give us what we had paid for. The room was lovely with good quality furniture and fittings, beautiful bathroom with everything you could possibly need. Breakfast was included in the price and it was very good. Could not fault this hotel for its location and very helpful staff. Anyone else booking with Alpha rooms should maybe check that they are being allocated the correct room especially since they have had our booking since June.

Reviews.Title: “the staff were simply amasing and the hotel fantastic”
Reviews.Author: steven44445
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly placed for your stay in Paris. The staff were amasing!!!! cant say this enough. The room was fantastic also. We stayed in executive suit and the room was perfect size, no 104( having read previous reviews about room size) The reason for my trip to paris was the propose. I had emailed the staff previous to let them know about this special occasion so they could make the room up to my requirements. They got back to me very quick indeed and had the room perfect for my arrival. They gave us complementary bottle of champagne upon arrival which was a nice touch. I asked for them to recommend a place to eat for the occasion, to which they showed me les ombres. Fantastic eating!! the view was amasing. They organised it for me at the last minute and managed to get me in to eat that nite at the time we wanted, was very impressed. Can see exactly why this hotel is in top 100 beautiques in the world!! and top 10 in paris, fantastic and unique place to stay. Go there!!

Reviews.Title: “Same as expected except for the small room”
Reviews.Author: Nuuskamuikkunen
Reviews.Content: I stayed this hotel only for one night. The hotel is exactly what I expected from other reviewers comments. Close access to Champs Elysees and Metro station, highly professional and kind staff, very clean and good facilities of the room, delicious and variety of breakfast, etc. Only one thing I was really disappointed was size of the room. I booked "Standard" room through online travel agency but room was extremely small and asked front desk if this is really standard or not. He looks a little bit hesitate and said "smallest size of our Standard Room". I asked may be this is your "Classic" room but he didn't change his comment. So, I was not sure at that time whether my room is really Standard or Classic, I gave up to ask anymore. However after I returned from my trip, I saw my room was "Classic" in their web site. I guess this is because of my price from Agoda which was quite cheaper than all other web site for Standard. If front desk told me the true reason, may be I'm not so regret with considering how much I paid. So, I have to downgrade the rate -1.0 for small size and another -1.0 for not telling me the true story. Classic rooms are located from floor 1-4 and room number's are 3 and 5. May be you can check the hotel which room you will get before you check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrKittty
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for four nights in early November. The hotel is within walking distance to many of the sites in Paris and close to a couple of metro stops. When I arrived I was upgraded to a suite which was fantastic. The room was quiet, spacious and warm. There was a separate sitting room which led to the main bedroom. The bathroom had a separate bath and shower. The hotel staff were very helpful and responsive.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great situation”
Reviews.Author: JamesandVictoria
Reviews.Content: Westayed at the Keppler hotel September 2008. When we arrived at the hotel after a long trip from Japan, we appreciated the quick and efficient check in. The room was nice and clean and well decorated but extremely small. I think that most hotel rooms in Paris are small, but this one was so small you could hardly open the wardrobe door as it couldn't clear the bed. The bathroom was very nice and clean and very pretty. I have 2 complaints about the bathroom: 1. The shower only dribbled out and we asked them to fix it. It was fixed the day before we left and we were there for 6 days. 2. The hairdryer was permanently attached under a shelf so you have to bend down to use it if you are over 5ft tall. I am 5ft7". The location of the hotel was great, close to the Arc de Triomphe, the Eiffel Tour and the Champs Elysee and there were lots of Metro stations around. Try and get a deal that includes breakfast. Do NOT believe that there are lots of nice little cafes around where you can get a good, inexpensive breakfast. There are not. On the whole the hotel was clean,comfortable and safe and the staff were really nice and helpful. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice!”
Reviews.Author: Jan060
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 2 night stay which was very enjoyable. Stayed in a standard room which although small was of very good standard. Fittings and fixtures were all good quality. A couple of small niggles - on arrival our room smelt of smoke which on mentioning it at reception they apologised and sent the cleaner to spray air freshner. I hadpreviously emailed the hotel and requested a non-smoking room as my partner is asthmatic. Also the room was very hot and the air conditioning had been switched off in the rooms for the winter so you had no control. Had to leave the window open at all times to keep the room temperature comfortable. That aside the hotel is lovely, the public rooms decorated and furnished beautifully. The breakfasts are very satisfying and all staff very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Keppler”
Reviews.Author: peakrunner
Reviews.Content: Hotel Keppler, Paris, France October 23 - 28 2008 My girlfriend and I spent 4 fantastic nights at the Keppler and would gladly recommend it to anyone going to Paris. This is a romantic, charming hotel, with lovely decor, and excellent/attentive staff. We were treated with the utmost courtesy. The hotel is ideally located close to the George V metro station, just 4 blocks off the Champs Elysees. Although close to the main thoroughfares( Avenue Marceau and the Champs Elysees) the rooms are really quiet. The only (small) nit I would say is that the rooms are a little small..maybe 'quaint' is a better term. Forgot to mention the fantastic workout/sauna/steam room facilities that are on site. Awesome. Have fun when you go. We'll certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “loved the keppler”
Reviews.Author: scorpionlimerick
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the keppler with my girlfriend for 2 nights on 21 and 22 october. I was to stay on the 20th october as well but the hotel phoned me when i was at the airport before i flew to paris to tell me that there were over booked on that night so they said they would but me up in the hotel vernet which is a few streets away from the keppler. When i got to the hotel vernet i was put into one of there suites which was lovely. The following day our suitcases were picked up for us and we went to the keppler hotel for our 2 night stay. I had booked an executive room but was up graded to one of there suites which was a way of making up for the mistake in my booking. The staff were so nice to myself and my girlfriend and we were looked after so well for our 2 nights stay there. The room had a balcony which we could sit out and have a drink which was so nice. The room service was also used by us and a big thanks to the gent who got us our drinks and food. I used the breakfast room for the 2 mornings and again the staff were great. I could not say a bad word about the hotel and its staff and myself and my girlfriend had a great time there.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the Reviews”
Reviews.Author: berkshire_nomads
Reviews.Content: I know nowhere else in Paris that strikes such a good balance between comfort and quality on the one hand and character on the other. The building is beautiful and has been very well decorated. The decor (black / cream with bright yellow highlights) is modern without being overly trendy. Quality of fittings and furnishings is high, especially the funky automatic dimmer switches. One point that stands out is the air con / heating, which is completely silent, so you can leave it on over night without being kept awake. I know of only one other hotel where its equally good. Staff are very pleasant and friendly, and the location is excellent, quiet but very close to the Etoile. Only two small gripes. Firstly the bedding is sheets and blankets rather than duvets, which I would much prefer. Secondly although the bathroom is beautfiul the shower seriously lacks power - just a trickle rather than the full blast you would expect. That aside this place is great. I come to Paris regularly but have never been able to get a room. After this week, I've already booked my next trip in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Not child friendly”
Reviews.Author: richardpod
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, amazing location,Please don't go with an infant, not only is it not child friendly,there isn't 1 high chair in th whole hotel. We had to feed our 18 month old on our knee during breakfast. NOT WHAT I WOULD EXPECT FROM A 4 STAR!!!!

Reviews.Title: “25th anniversary choice”
Reviews.Author: ianpeean
Reviews.Content: The Keppler is as advertised. We arrived, jet-lagged and shown to an executive room which smelled of smoke. Not the greatest of introductions, but the hotel made it right. They put us in a suite that night but then had to move the next day (sad - the suite was really nice. Even had a view of the Eiffel Tower). As it was our 25th anniversary, a nice bottle of bubbly was chilling in our room when we arrived. We ended up in an Executive Room on the 3rd floor. It faced the courtyard which is actually quite pleasant. Without exaggeration, it was THE QUIETEST room I've ever stayed in. I can say that because I travel with a mini recording studio and microphone. The air-conditioning seeps through an unobtrusive vent above the bed and doesn't make a sound either. A real bonus for me and my midnight recording session hookups back to the States. The staff was fabulous. Especially Phillipe. You might think this strange, but we never even looked at the breakfast room. Its not that I'm cheap. Well, okay, so I'm a little cheap... but I really prefer eating the way the locals do. We walked down the street to a cafe for the BEST croissants I've ever had. So much so that I actually preferred the plain to the chocolate! Oops- sidetracked. I just couldn't bring myself to spend 22 Euros PER PERSON for breakie... Oh, and maybe some of that is because if you need internet which I did - it's expensive too. 88 Euros for 5 days or 22 per day (ouch). Despite this the stay was fantastic and I highly recommend this hotel. The fabrics, decor and cleanliness where stellar. And this is coming from an EXTREMELY picky hotel guest. Strange thing - the street is RUE KEPLER, but the hotel is spelled KEPPLER (two P's). Strange indeed. PS - just down the street is "VELIB" the Paris bike rental system. DO IT. It's really fun and easy. PPS - Try a Parisian macaroon. anywhere. Two places I can highly recommend for them are PAULS (multiple locations) and the mother of macaroon shops on the Champs, LADUREE. WOW.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: ThedukesDevon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Keppler in September after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. So glad we did, because amongst the thousands of hotels in Paris, The Keppler was perfect! Great location, beautiful hotel and staff who just couldn't do enough to help. It's not a huge hotel and it almost felt like staying in a private house. We were made to feel welcome from the moment we stepped foot in the door. It was our first trip to Paris and we can highly recommend this hotel. Yes, it's a little pricey - but worth it, especially if you're having a special getaway. Only thing I'd say is avoid the breakfast. There's absolutely nothing wrong with it, but you can grab a croissant and coffee for half the price around the corner!

Reviews.Title: “Really great experience at the Hotel Keppler”
Reviews.Author: lgouldin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Keppler in August and had a terrific experience. Our executive double was spacious and nicely furnished. The room looked just like the photos on the website. We had a view of the courtyard and felt the room was quiet and very clean. We were able to get a third night for free by booking through a discount site, which was terrific. The breakfast was wonderful -- full of all the delightful French pastries you would expect -- plus eggs (even omelettes to order, I think). Most noteworthy, though, was the staff. Every person we encountered at the hotel was friendly and the men at the front desk could not have been more helpful. They spoke perfect English and were very forgiving of my lousy French. All in all, a really great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: honeymooner1
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days at the Keppler and loved it from the minute we arrived. It is a lovely place - really well decorated. The staff were really friendly, much more so than at other hotels i have stayed in but without being overly fussy. The rooms (we stayed in a classic room which is their regular one) were lovely. Yes they are small but no more so than other Parisian hotels and the beautiful decoration more than makes up for it. The rooms had every comfort you could need and the bathrooms especially were great/ We didn't use either service but nice to have room service and also a spa - if I go back i will definately try them both! Location is good - obviously steos away from the C.E and great for metro stops etc. In my opinion not great for choice of good, reasonably priced food - lots of chain restaurants around on main road but these weren't my ideal choice! Nice brasseries around the side streets and near the hotel though. Lots of top end places too but these were out of our budget! Not a big problem though as easy to take metro anywhere. All in all definatley would recommend this hotel - if you like luxury and good location with great staff you can't go wrong! really nice breakfast too!

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel - believe the hype!”
Reviews.Author: stuartandalex
Reviews.Content: Just a short review to say how fantastic the Hotel Keppler is. We stayed for three nights in an Executive room with our baby. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff, and they sorted out a cot for us. The room was large and spacious and the bathroom superb. Breakfast in bed every morning at no extra cost was a great touch and I cannot fault the hotel at all. Very clean, modern and the staff polite, friendly and professional. About 5 minutes walk from the Champs-Elysees and the Arc de Tromphe - super location! Downstairs there is a gym and a sauna and steam room, and all are state of the art and modern (not that we had time to use them). Would definitely visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SteveandSonya
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The staff, location and decor were all fantastic. We had a king double deluxe room which was perfect. So beautifully decorated, so French. We felt really comfortable in this hotel. It is in a lovely quiet street but so close to lots of tourist icons. Staff gave us great sightseeing advice. Good tip to catch Metro to Louvre and enter across from station (not thru glass pyramid). This saved us heaps of time - no queue, we walked straight in, couldn't believe it. They also booked us into 'Kong' restaurant and managed to get us a table (great restaurant, good views, great atmosphere). We definitely want to stay at this hotel again - we miss it already!

Reviews.Title: “Just terrific”
Reviews.Author: lindseyjeanne
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Keppler is a fabulous boutique hotel. The location is great--centrally located but on a quieter street so there's not much noise. The rooms were well-decorated and spotless. I loved this hotel and will definitely stay there again the next time I'm in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “top class hotel”
Reviews.Author: anthonydonegal
Reviews.Content: just back from four day stay at the keppler hotel. this was our fourth time in paris and this is without doubt the best hotel we stayed in. the hotel is spotless and the rooms were cleaned to a high standard every day. the rooms contained everything one needed including a mini bar. the hotel is perfectly situated in a quite street and is less than a five minute walk to arc de triomphe or midway down the champ de elyeese. there is a good local bakery around corner and local shop for drinks and such like. the breakfast in morning is excellent with top class service. have seen on other reviews that people have complained about the size of room. this is paris and no hotel rooms are of a size similar to other countries. but i found that there was more than enough space. would definetly be back and recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Superbe”
Reviews.Author: macfactor
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently for a 3 night break, celebrating my birthday along with my wife. From the moment we stepped into the air conditioned reception, following a journey from GDG airport on the bus. We both cannot fault the hotel whatsoever. The friendliness, the assistance, and the warm atmosphere of the place, gave us confidence in the place right from the start. I have always looked on Trip Advisor for information that people kindly share for others, but never having commented myself before. I just felt that because we were so pleased with our decision to stay at the hotel, it warranted a comment. Thankyou to Phillipe, Matheau and all the staff at the Keppler. Certainly will go back and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Four Star Hotel With Five Star Staff”
Reviews.Author: TRIALIST
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in July and immediately were impressed with Staff greeting and pre arranged flowers to room,restaurant booking and taxi taken care of. With previous experience of claimed four star status we were wary of our expectations.Happily , the Keppler is worthy of its status with a fresh, bright aspect and almost tranquil flavour. The staff put the final polish on our stay.Very proffesional with friendly , helpful attitude gave us a memorable hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: quatloo2
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel. Stayed June 27-July 2 with wife. Had standard room which was modern, clean, and fresh. Smallish by North American standards but acceptable for Europe. Larger rooms were available. On side street so rooms very quiet. All front staff excellent and very helpful with tour and restaurant reservations. Five minute walk to Champs Elysees and George V Metro station. Great mid-upper level restaurants 5-6 minutes away on rue Marbeuf including French, Italian, and Chinese where dinner for two with wine ran 65 Euros. Skipped expensive hotel breakfast for local boulangerie around corner at 13 rue Bassano for cafe au lait and croissant for 3 euros per person. Would highly recommend Hotel Keppler for couples, lovers, and the like and would return without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luxurydiva
Reviews.Content: What a lovely friendly hotel. The standard rooms are a little on the small size but beautifully decorated. The foyer and dining room were exquisite. The breakfasts were excellent. The staff were extremely helpful and all round its a really fantastic place to stay. This is one I definitely want to visit again

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Boutique 4 Star Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RMCONNERS
Reviews.Content: Our stay---July 3 to July 8 This is a lovely boutique hotel that I booked through GTAHOTELS at a terrific rate! We pre-paid the hotel in US Dollars and that helped tremendously. We booked a standard room and as others have said, they are beautifully decorated. The rooms appear to be very clean and the beds are comfortable. We had a street side room but, I didn't notice much noise which was great! When I spoke to the concierge about the lovely decor, he told me it was done by the same designer who did the George V. Just to set your expectations, the rooms are VERY small which is somewhat to be expected in Europe. My guess is that our room was about 10' x 12' + a small entrance hallway and bathroom. Our room had two very small wardrobes so pack light! We were thankful it was summer so our clothes weren't bulky. For us the room was fine because we just used it as a place to sleep. The rooms all have slightly different color themes, throws and softgoods but, for the most part they look exactly as pictured on their website. As previous posters have mentioned, there really isn't anywhere to put your suitcases. We stashed ours in the little alcoves in front of the two windows. For those who are traveling in the summer, the AC in this hotel is excellent! It's probably the best I've ever experienced at any hotel in Paris. Problem was, the 5 days we were there it was unseasonably cold so we didn't need it. An expanded continental bufftet breakfast is included with the rate. This includes juice, a variety of coffees & teas, yogurt, fruit, cereals, eggs, breakfast meat and potatoes. They also offer to cook omlets and eggs to order. In addition, they bring each table a basket of fresh breads and pasteries. Breakfast was served from 7-11am and I believe you can have it in your room as well? We never did this so I can't comment on what you get but I'd assume it's the same. The poster who said that cab drivers in Paris have no idea where the street is located, is correct. Our driver from the airport entered the address info into his GPS and he still couldn't find the hotel. I had printed a copy of the map from the hotels website and handed it to the driver and he still had trouble finding the street! Make sure you bring a map with you just in case the driver can't find it. I know our map helped the driver and he did eventually figure it out but the costs start to add up while he's driving around looking for the little side street. I know many people have RAVED about the staff at this hotel. They were fine but, I wouldn't go overboard raving about them. When asked, they will of course answer questions and make recommendations. I just didn't think they go out of their way to help. I know it's not the George V, but still. I have stayed at other hotels in Paris where the staff really did go out of their way to be friendly and helpful but, we didn't have the same experience as others have. To their credit however, they did make all our restaurant reservations, which was very helpful. My cell phone died earlier in the trip so I was not able to make my own dinner reservations. For the most part I knew what restaurants we planned to eat at so it was just a matter of the concierge phoning each restaurant. They also did make one very good restaurant recommendation---Marco Polo, a somewhat casual Italian Restaurant in the St Germain area. The restaurant was excellent and I'd go back in a heartbeat! This hotel is very central if you're a tourist. It's about a 5 minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe & Champs Elysees and maybe 10 to 15 minutes to the Eiffel Tower. The hotel is located in the 16th Arrond but very close to the 8th. We also had an issue with housekeeping during our stay. The hotel encourages everyone to be "green" and reuse towels, which is fine. We used ours for 2 days and then put them in the tub to signal the housekeeper to replace them since my DH had come down with a cold. I was told by the housekeeping staff that there was a problem and they didn't have any bath towels. In lieu of the bath towels she gave me 2 hand towels! Later I ran into another housekeeper in the hall and she told me they still didn't have any towels. This went on for the remainder of our stay. So for 3 days we went without bath towels. Each day we'd come back to change for dinner, I'd look in the bathroom and there would be no bath towels. That got irritating. Overall I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel. I personally am not in love with the location but, I knew that going into it. I'd be hard pressed to beat the price we paid thru GTAHOTELS so it made this hotel hard to pass up. I think anyone who stays here would overall be very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms, but housekeeping needs more monitoring”
Reviews.Author: isisy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Keppler during our 4-day trip in Paris. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay in the hotel. The decor was wonderful, and the conceige and bell-boy are both very helpful. But, I do have a few things to point out: 1. I had no soap in my bathroom until the last day of my stay. Not sure why that's the case, but I had to go hunt for a bar of soap on my first day in Paris 2. One of the days, when the maid cleaned our room, she took all the towels that was on the floor and didn't replace them. However, when I called housekeeping for additional towels, they were delivered immediately. 3. And I did discover some hair strand on the throw that does not belong to me, which is a bit disturbing. I understand the throw might be difficult to clean at times, and the dirt is quite noticable when the throw is white. But, I think the hotel should make an effort to clean the throws, especially when the customers are being charged a premium for the rooms. Other than that, the hotel has lived up to its reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: maens
Reviews.Content: I and my wife stayed at the hotel for our 5th anniversary, we enjoyed every moment, the hotel design is magnificent, reception is beautiful, we had a standard room which was not "standard", room was beautiful and clean, Staff at the reception is very helpful, breakfast also was great, service was good and the staff was very good, summary: first class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff make this one of the best hotels in Paris”
Reviews.Author: CitadineLondon
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a long weekend at the Keppler with my boyfriend, staying in a superior room. It was simply the best trip I have had anywhere in ages, thanks in no small part to the fantastic service at the Keppler. I certainly won't be trying out any other hotel in Paris any time soon. In the interests of full disclosure - a couple of things you should know about the hotel: * The rooms are small, even by Parisian standards.
