They are fine if you are planning to be out and about for most of the time (and why wouldn't you, this is Paris!), but there isn't much space to work for example, or sit down anywhere other than the bed. * Whilst our room was beautifully decorated and spotless, the design of the wardrobe doors isn't very smart. In a small space, a sliding door would have enabled good access to the wardrobe - instead it has folding doors which can't quite open because the bed is in the way. * Rue Kepler is a quiet side street and most taxi drivers don't have a clue where it is. Ask for "Rue du Bassano, pres d'Avenue Marceau" and Rue Kepler is on the right. Now for the main plus points (there are more, but the review would be too long): * The design is funky, but well thought through. There are comfortable places to sit in the common areas, with a mix of books and magazines in English, French and other languages. * Really good triple glazing in the rooms. You can't hear a thing outside when the windows are closed. * The bar is small and you wouldn't want to spend all evening there, but the cocktails are excellent. You almost feel like they are being made for you in your own front room. * Good breakfast by Parisian standards, and the breakfast room is light and welcoming (despite being sub-ground) thanks to a clever atrium/lightwell. * Even though the hotel was full when we stayed, we rarely saw other guests and there were no queues for reception on arrival or departure. Really felt like we were one of the only people at the hotel. * Finally and most importantly, the amazing staff. Nothing was too much trouble, whether it was finding us a reservation at a 2* Michelin restaurant for dinner, or recommending a day trip, or returning some lost property to us. Phillipe and Roman, in particular, could not have been more helpful or charming and really made the stay for us.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: LMR56
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 3 nights at Hotel Keppler with our daughter having gone there to celebrate her 21st birthday. We had a very warm welcome including a surprise birthday present - quality toiletries and half bottle of champagne which was very much appreciated! We had the penthouse which is beautifully decorated with two bedrooms (one quite small but with a very large bed and the other with views of the Eiffel Tower), a lounge area and two excellent bathrooms. The mini TV screens in the bathroom mirrors were a real novelty. There were flatscreen TVs in each room plus a dvd, ipod speakers and internet access (for a charge). We found the penthouse very quiet and extremely comfortable with excellent beds. The whole hotel is wonderfully decorated, the breakfast was excellent (although not included) and the staff very helpful with good English. We only had one grumble, that we found it difficult to get a drink on our return each evening and when we did, it was very expensive! The ice machine was broken and we didn't even get lemon in our luke warm G&T. The person on duty couldn't apparently open a bottle of wine so we gave up and resorted to the mini-bar which unfortunately hadn't been restocked! If the bar had been better we would certainly have given an excellent rating and we will definitely go back there if we return to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks To All In The Keppler Team....”
Reviews.Author: MikeCratchley
Reviews.Content: A heartfelt thanks to all the truly professional people working at the Keppler who helped to make our stay in Paris a truly memorable one. From the moment we walked through the door and discovered that the organisation through which we booked (Federal) had mysteriously cancelled our two rooms, we realised that we were in the hands of people who truly understand what hotel-keeping is really all about. Within a few minutes the problem was resolved (and it had nothing to do with the Keppler) and we were shown to our Standard rooms - which were way beyond what i would describe as 'standard'. Everything, apart from the size, is truly superb. If you really need lots of room, then book a suite. Whatever we asked for, from room service to help and advice on where to go and where to eat, was responded to with enthusiasm and expert knowledge - so refreshing for a city not known for such caring and hospitality. My only beef is that it is in a commercial area where not much is open in the immediate vicinity after around 11.00pm - although you don't have to walk too far to find it! The Keppler is one of Paris's real treasures, so thanks to all of the previous reviewers who encouraged us to make it our home from home.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Philleas_Fogg_uette
Reviews.Content: This hotel is faultless. It is well located, really wonderfully decorated and extremely clean and all the staff are very polite and helpfull. The breakfast room is very pleasant and breakfast includes a wide and well presented variety of items. My sister I had a twin executive room with plenty of living and wardrobe space and a lovely bathroom with a tv integrated in the miror. The beds and pillows were very comfortable and the room was very quiet, ensuring a great sleep. The air conditioning was quiet and efficient. Turn down service was a nice touch. Overall we were extremely happy with this hotel, and we would recommend it to anyone who enjoys top quality.

Reviews.Title: “Something different in Paris”
Reviews.Author: whatsinitforme
Reviews.Content: The Keppler Hotel is a unique boutique Hotel i discovered in searching Tripadvisor and am happy to advise almost all which has been said about the Hotel is correct. Staff are super friendly and are very welcoming.....a big Hi to Matthew and Roman at the Hotel (they do read the reviews!) and do pay attention to peoples comments which i find refreshing. Its location is wonderful just around the corner from the Champs Elysee and George the V shopping district. Breakfast is a delight and the staff will guide you to local restaurants,subway or any other needs. Tip...try Sardi an Italian restaurant not far from the Hotel......sensational!!!!!! and try Hotel Keppler,you will not be disappointed.....its french,its quirky,its a little Parisian secret for now!!!! Enjoy it before everyone else finds out about it.

Reviews.Title: “Best week-end ever”
Reviews.Author: Adriana_8
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great staff, i'll recommend it to all my friends and Planigo's clients.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Keppler
HotelInfo.Address: 10, Rue Keppler | 16 Arr., 75 116 Paris, France
